She grabs a small waste basket and scoops you and Josh up before you have a chance to suggest a different plan. She hides you and the formulas in a cabinet. You stand awkwardly in the waste basket trying to avoid touching Josh.

Kellie's friend comes in but all she does is ask where the mix playlist is. Kellie answers and her friend goes back upstairs.

Kellie looks down inside the waste basket at the two of you and says, "How cute." She shakes the basket causing the two of you to bump into each other. You and Josh yell for Kellie to stop but she bumps you and Josh into each other a few more times. She doesn't stop until you and Josh are tangled in a pile.

She gives you a break and you and Josh separate. She asks, "So let me see if I can interpret that less than clear explanation you said earlier. You will grow but the bigger you get, the slower you will grow, therefore it will take your whole lifetime to get back to normal size. Are you sure of that?"

You say, "No, the size changes are not completely predictable. It's even possible that we might shrink again. However, I have studied the formula enough to be confident that the bigger we get, the more formula is required to trigger a size change in either direction. That's why I was working on an antidote both to restore height and to prevent random size changes."

Kellie said, "So what am I supposed to do with two doll sized men?" She grabs both of you in one hand pressing Josh's naked body against your naked body.
142232.title: Someone interrupts

choices: Andy decides to have a small sip of the formula or the antidote
Andy decides to try a different formula
143.content:
At that moment, Andy, Matt's best friend, entered the area. "Hey, Andy!" Matt called. But it was useless; for he was too tiny to be heard. Just then Andy looked at the table bottle with the shrink formula and the bottle with the antidote on it.

What was gonna happen next? You decide!
143.title: Andy enters the basement

1431.content:
Matt watched as Andy walked over to the table! He was worried. What could happen if Andy drunk the formula? He would be shrunk! If Andy drunk the antidote, what could happen? [You will have to decide that one!]

Well? Which choice, then? Formula or antidote? Or does Andy see Matt? You will decide that one!!
1431.title: Formula Or Antidote?

14311.content: 'Oh no.' Matt thought as Andy grabbed the shrinking formula. Andy took a sip. How small was Andy gonna get?
14311.title: Formula

143111.content:
Suddenly, Matt gasped. Andy was gone! Matt ran over to Andy's huge clothes. "Andy!" Matt called. "Can you hear me?"

"Yes, I can hear you, Matt!" A voice said. It was Andy. And HE was naked too! "Wow!" said Andy! "Your shrinking potion actually works!"

"That's good!" Matt said. "We'd better get the antidote so we can grow back to normal size!"

But then...
143111.title: Shrinky Andy

1431111.content: Suddenly, Matt and Andy began to feel very strange. Some odd side effects of the shrinking formula happened. what was happening?
1431111.title: changes occur

14311112.content:
Andy noticed the change first, not on himself but on his friend.

A long tail had sprouted from Matt's backside, but Matt hadn't seemed to notice.

"Dude, you've got a tail," Andy told his pal.

Matt attempted to twist around to glimpse the new appendage. But then he got something better when he looked at Andy and burst into laughter.

"Looks like you have one, too!"

Andy gasped and grabbed the tip of the long tail. "This isn't good. What weird side effect is this?"

Matt started to answer but the changes continued.
14311112.title: The 'tail' continues

143111122.content:
Matt looked down and saw his feet. There was a tan webbing in between his toes, which had lost the toenails. And the same thing had happened to Andy's feet too!

The changes continued with them getting...
143111122.title: Frog Feet Boys

1431112.content:
...Matt's dad Roger came in.

Roger was also a scientist, but a rather absent-minded one. Roger had always encourage his son's scientific endeavors, no matter how crazy they sounded. And they often were.

What was gonna happen now that Matt's dad Roger was in the lab?
1431112.title: Matt's dad Roger comes in

14311122.content:
Matt watched as his dad walked over to the table! He was worried. What could happen if Roger drunk the formula? He would be shrunk! If he drunk the antidote, what could happen? [You will have to decide that one!]

Well? Which choice, then? Formula or antidote?
14311122.title: Roger drinks the forumla/antidote

choices: Half an inch tall [Matt and Andy's size]
143111221.content: 'Oh no.' Matt thought as he and Andy saw Roger grabbed the shrinking formula. And then Roger took a sip. How small was Matt's dad gonna get?
143111221.title: Formula

1431112211.content:
Roger suddenly wobbled, then sank down into his loosening clothes, then disappeared. Matt and Andy gasped as Roger climbed out of his massive shirt.

He was naked, and he was the same size as Matt and Andy!

"Wow!" said Andy. "Your shrinking potion really does work!"

"That's good!" Matt said. "We'd better get the antidote so we can all grow back to normal size!"

But then...
1431112211.title: 300th Chapter: Shrinking Roger

choices: Nothing. The side effect was drowsiness
14311122111.content: The three tiny men grew drowsy. They all fell deep into a slumber on the lab floor and when they woke up...
14311122111.title: Side effects occur

143111221112.content:
Matt, Andy and Roger all wake up on the floor the exact same as before. However they could hear the two voices outside one was Kellie’s

“Yeah all three of them were in the lab but I can’t find any of them now!”

Then she opens the door and in walks the giant muscular frame of your dads older military brother Kevin he looks around and spots you on the floor and tells Kellie to go while he looks around. He then..
143111221112.title: Uncle Kevin

143111222.content: He picked the antidote! Matt and Andy gasped. Roger drunk it. Matt and Andy gasped again!
143111222.title: Antidote

14312.content: He picked the antidote! Matt gasped. Andy drunk it. Matt gasped again!
14312.title: Antidote

143122.content: Andy started to glow in a bright red light. Suddenly, he slowly began to grow! Matt watched in horror as Matt grew till he was slightly bigger in size. Matt could see that Andy's shirt was no longer completely covering his chest, his trousers were tight, and his socks poked out of his shoes!
143122.title: Andy grows huge

1431222.content: Any started to glow again! 'Here comes the growing again!' Matt thought. And Matt was right on cue. Andy started to grow again, his shirt now starting to rip. Andy's shoes suddenly exploded, now that they were too small for his feet. Matt ducked to avoid bits of Andy's shoes flying at him. He saw that Andy was now huge! Andy's shirt looked ripped, and his toes were poking right out of his socks!
1431222.title: Andy begins to grow again.

14312221.content: The small Matt climbed onto his now giant friend's stomach. Andy was huge before, but now he was bigger! 'Wow.' Matt thought. 'I never knew my antidote had that effect!" Then Andy saw Matt! What would happen next?
14312221.title: Andy sees Matt.

choices: Matt reverts to his old (shrunken) self
144.content:
Matt was shocked to find the formula would have such a dramatic effect and, for the moment, he was stuck this way, but he reasoned that sooner or later someone would come looking for him and after getting their attention he could be changed back.

He waited for what seemed like hours for Kellie to get home from school. She probably would want to talk with him about homework or something. Once she got over the shock of seeing him like this, getting returned to normal would be no problem. Matt's only worry was whether she would bring her friends with her. He didn't really want to appear tiny and naked in front of all her friends, it would be hard enough with just her....

His thoughts were soon interrupted by the basement door opening and footsteps on the wooden staircase. The sound of girls talking let him know right away that Kellie was here with her friends. Turning crimson, Matt wished there was a way for him to cover himself a little better. Unfortunately, he would get his wish in a way that he didn't intend. Matt felt a tingling sensation over his entire body as some unprecedented side effects began....

Kellie reached the bottom of the stairs. Behind her were her two friends, Julie and Samantha. "Matt, where are you" Kellie called. Looking around, she saw Matt's notebook laying on the table, along with a jar containing some kind of blue liquid, and a pile of his clothes in the corner. "Are you sure he's here?" asked Julie. Kellie's confused expression made her look in the same direction, at the empty pile of clothes. "Oooh he must be naked!" Samantha exclaimed. "Yuck, I hope not" said Julie. Her eyes traveled to a tiny, tan object not far from the pile of clothes. "Hey Kellie, what is that?" "What's what?" "That thing moving around near Matt's shirt."

Kellie, Julie and Samantha walked over to the tan object moving across the floor. By some trick of light it appeared to be getting darker as they approached, and changing shape slightly. By the time they were standing over it, it looked completely different. "Oh, it's just a fly. It looked really weird for a minute, almost like it was...." Julie drifted off, unsure of what to say. Samantha bent down and blew a puff of air at the fly. Almost immediately, it took off and began circling the girls. "Shoo, get out of here" Samantha said, swatting at it. Almost as though it understood, the fly took off up the stairs and out of the basement.

Julie was the first to break the silence. "Let's go to Wendy's for some fast food. We can find Matt later." "Alright", Kellie agreed, preoccupied with what she had just seen. Surely it was just her mind playing tricks on her.
144.title: Side effects

choices: Find another way into the basement
1442.content:
Matt, resting for a moment on a huge coffee table in the living room, felt extremely confused.

"What's happened to me?" Matt wondered.

One moment, he had been cowering near his over-sized clothes after shrinking to a half inch size. Then, when possible rescue arrived in the form of his gigantic sister and her friends, he had...changed!

He remembered buzzing around Kellie and her friends, and almost being swatted by one of them, who shooed him away like...like a fly.

Even now, he felt the strange feeling of wings on his back. "I'm a fly!"

He had never meant his formula to do this.

"My formula!" Matt thought. The antidote on the table in the basement! His new wings would give him access to it now.

He hesitated. Something must have gone wrong with his formula. What if he took it and grew into a five foot tall fly?

Before he could make up his mind, Kellie, Samantha and Julie emerged from the basement. They looked impossibly huge.

Matt made up his mind. He should fly back to the basement and...

Just as he used his new wings to lift into the air, Kellie slammed closed the door to the basement.

"Oh no!" Matt thought.
1442.title: Fly Boy

14421.content:
His day, Matt decided, wasn't going well.

The 17-year-old had not only shrunk himself to the pathetic size of half an inch tall, but had somehow caused a weird metamorphosis with his half-baked formula to the effect he was now buzzing around his own living room as a tiny fly.

Matt settled on the vertical living room wall while he tried to think rationally about his transformation.

The most likely explanation, he decided, was that at some stage his shrinking formula had been contaminated. Perhaps a fly had stumbled into the formula, mixing its DNA with the powerful ingredients.

The possibility presented a new host of problems. Would his antidote, still on hand in his basement lab, restore his size along with his human form?

While Matt pondered, his sister and her friends prepared to leave for lunch at their favorite fast food restaurant.

Although he felt tempted to follow them, he nixed the idea. His time might be better spent finding a way back into his basement laboratory.

Although he used the stairwell inside the house to access his lab, Matt speculated on some possible avenues of entry.

An old stairwell from the outside of the house also accessed the storage area of the basement. Dusty and littered with old cobwebs, that deep pit might be his best opportunity.

If that failed, several screened vents were located along the upper walls of the basement. Could he squeeze his tiny fly body through one of the screens?

Both options depended on getting outside the house and seeking to regain entry to his basement.

The girls, looking like giants, were on the move.

Matt knew he lacked the luxury of time. Should he fly out the front door when they left or would it be more sensible to stay in his current location?

He saw Kellie's hand on the front door.
14421.title: Fly on the Wall

choices: Matt dares the stairwell to get to his lab and antidote
Matt flies into the yard to avoid the exterminator
144211.content:
For someone with a scientific intellect, making split-second decisions didn't come naturally to Matt.

The 17-year-old genius had planned to shrink himself to the pathetic size of half an inch tall, have some fun and then restore himself to normal size. Obviously, his formula still had some flaws because in the process, he has metamorphosed into a tiny fly.

The arrival of his sister and her friends, all three girls looking impossibly huge, brought into focus the extent of his dilemma.

He needed desperately to get back to his makeshift basement lab. With access to his antidote, perhaps he could reverse the bizarre transformation and regain his human form and size.

Events were moving by with a blur-like speed, even as his six tiny legs clung to the vertical surface of the living room wall.

Kellie, Samantha and Julie walked in unison toward the front door. Flying outside with them looked to be his only hope of admittance to his lab after his sister has closed the interior door leading to the basement.

He was a little nervous, especially after seeing the size of the girls, about venturing into the vast outside world.

Kellie led the way, and her transformed fly-boy brother left the wall and buzzed toward them. He zipped between Julie and Samantha, emerging into a world grown colossal in all respects.

Even with his wings buzzing like mad, the tiny fly failed to keep pace with them. In only a moment, they left him behind as they got into Julie's car and drove off.

He didn't let that concern him overly much. There would seem to be very little Kellie or her friends could do for him at the moment. It just might be safer without them looming over him.

He renewed his determination to get back into his lab.

One route was represented by an old stairwell from the outside of the house that also accessed the storage area of the basement. Dusty, littered with old cobwebs, and crowded with crates and boxes, that deep pit might be his best opportunity. He flew toward the old stairwell, but the deep tunnel looked very dark to the tiny fly-boy.

He reconsidered, thinking it might be safer to try some of the screened vents located along the upper walls of the basement. He began searching for some opening in the screen that would let his tiny fly body squeeze through.

Landing on a screen, he could peer into his basement lab. He could see his antidote, waiting for him, held in a bottle on a gigantic table. Seeing it made him even more desperate to get back into his lab. The mesh of the wire screen, however, didn't offer any viable entrances.

Frustrated, he flew back toward the exterior stairwell, settling on a concrete ledge. He was debating his next move when a large yellow van with red lettering on the side pulled into the paved driveway.

Tiny Matt looked curiously at the huge vehicle, but when he read the letters he felt real fear.

MATHESON PEST CONTROL loomed in huge red letters against the yellow van.

A few months ago, his mother had been aggravated by a problem with ants in her kitchen. She had convinced Matt's father to hire the services of an exterminator to come out once a month to inspect and spray for bugs.

When Matt saw the huge exterminator in an orange and red uniform step out of the van, his mind was made up...
144211.title: Venturing Out

choices: Matt is grazed by the insecticide
Matt is doused by the insecticide
1442112.content:
Justin stepped out of the van and walked to the back of the vehicle to fetch his pest-control equipment, including an assortment of sticky traps and a large spray canister of extra-strength insecticide.

The young man had been employed with the service for only a few weeks, making this is first visit to this customer's home. He looked at the report, which indicated a past ant infestation but no serious problems since that time.

Carrying everything with him, he walked from the driveway to the sidewalk to the back of the customer's home. He passed a dusty stairwell and peered into the shadowy, dusty passageway. "Looks like a likely place for little pests to hide out," he remarked. "Might as well start out here."

As he started down the stairs, he heard a buzzing around his ears and saw a blurry, tiny shape as it flew away from the stairwell toward the yard. He absently swatted at it with his free hand, but didn't get bent out of shape because of one stray fly.

The exterminator's reaction had shocked Matt. He had been clearing out, but the guy must have heard or seen him. The tiny fly-boy evaded the swat, but the guy's huge hand had raked his body with air currents as it passed through the air near him.

As much as he feared the toxin-toting behemoth, Matt realized the exterminator might be an unexpected opportunity. If he followed him, as a safe distance, the guy might open the door to let Matt slip back inside his lab. The transformed teen felt confident he could regain his human form and size if he could simply regain possession of the antidote.

So, instead of remaining in the jungle of a yard, Matt flew back toward the stairwell, hoping to follow the gigantic man down the steps and into his lab.

One problem was that Justin, still new to the job, liked to make a very thorough effort. He raked away cobwebs that had accumulated in corners for years. He sprayed streams of insecticide into various nooks and crannies in the concrete walls of the stairwell.

Tiny Matt buzzed in the background, impatient for the huge guy to make it to the basement. "Enough already!" He buzzed. "Just go to my lab, please!"

Justin got to the bottom step and faced the door that led inside to the basement. He brushed away another cobweb in the corner, this time dislodging a spider that fell to the floor and started to crawl away.

"Yes!" Matt buzzed and zipped forward. "This is my chance."

Justin saw the spider trying to scurry to a new hiding place, so he lifted a boot and brought it down with a crunch.

At that same moment, he heard an irritating buzz near his head. "Should have spared that spider," he reconsidered. "At least they're good at catching flies."

Of course, many people didn't consider anything about the ecological benefit of spiders, instead just surrendering to their unreasonable fear of the eight-legged creatures.

Matt realized he had anticipated too soon, arriving at the door before the giant man opened it.

Justin heard the irritating grow louder in his ears, then he saw the tiny fly hovering between him and the door.

"Gotcha, you little fucker," he said while aiming the nozzle attached to the insecticide tank on his back.

Matt tried to buzz past the bulky man, now desperate to get past him and to safety. His plan had turned into a nightmare. The solution was on the other side of the huge, heavy door… but he could not risk it.

Justin squeezed the trigger to spew a stream of insecticide...
1442112.title: Wrong kind of attention

choices: Matt regains power of flight in nick of time
14421122.content:
Why hadn't he simply followed his instincts and kept his distance from the huge exterminator?

Now, trying to fly out of the deep concrete stairwell, Matt buzzed his tiny fly body past cobwebs, enormous crates and, most of all, the giant exterminator in the red and yellow uniform.

His distrust of a man trained to destroy and and all tiny creatures only increased when, incensed by the buzzing of Matt's wings, he aimed the nozzle of his insecticide canister at the irritating insect. "Now I've got you!"

Matt veered out of the oncoming path of the stream of liquid, which instead splashed against the concrete blocks that formed the walls of the stairwell.

Matt heard the huge exterminator's growl of aggravation at having missed. The tiny fly-boy knew he needed to escape the stairwell and get to the safety of the yard, away from this killer. All thoughts of his antidote in his basement laboratory had been relegated to a much lower priority as he struggled just to keep the man from doing his daily job, which was to exterminate insects like the one for all intents and purposes Matt had become.

His wings carried him higher… just a little farther.

BLAM! Another volley from the tank of lethal liquid strapped to Justin's back found its target. The splash of insecticide burned and blinded him, and the buzzing of his wings began to falter as he careened into the concrete wall. His wings still buzzed in a sputtering fashion, but one began to twitch in an unhelpful way. Out of control, the tiny fly-boy spiraled toward the wide lower steps of the deep stairwell.

When he crashed onto the concrete surface, he tried to gain control of his body. His six thin legs twitched and rebelled against his attempts to order them with his mind. Painfully, his vision was gradually coming back to him.

What he saw, however, almost made him wish he'd stayed blind.

The enormous man in his red and yellow uniform loomed over him, his boots planted several steps higher on the flight of stairs. The man was staring at the dusty steps. When he saw his target, a tiny, twitchy insect, he grinned and stepped closer. His huge boots lifted high into the air, giving Matt an unobstructed look at the wide, destructive soles. Deep in some of the tread, he saw the unidentifiable remains of other hapless bugs.

One wing continued to malfunction, preventing Matt from taking flight again. In desperation, he tried to crawl, but the dose of toxin has also played havoc with control over his six spindly legs.

The shadow of one of the boots fell over him...
14421122.title: Downed

choices: In shock, Matt spits slime onto the exterminator's face
144211221.content:
The sole of Justin's humongus boot came nearer and nearer and nearer and nearer and nearer still.

and then...

Matt felt his wing regaining flight power.

and just as Matt was about to be crushed, he flew away just in time.

Justin roared in anger, as if it were from an immense foghorn.
144211221.title: in the nick of time

choices: Matt pushes the exterminator's boot over
144211222.content:
The sole of Justin's humongusboot came nearer and nearer and nearer and nearer and nearer still.

and then...
and then...
and then...
and then...

WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?!
144211222.title: The end of fly-boy Matt?

choices: Matt spits slime onto Justin's face
1442112221.content:
The sole of Justin's humongus boot came nearer and nearer and nearer and nearer and nearer still.

and then...

Matt felt himself feeling a little stronger.

and just as Matt was about to be crushed, He pushed hard against Justin's boot.

Justin felt himself fall on his back. He slid down the rest of the way of the stairs.

He saw the Matt fly.

"I don't know what crazy lab you escaped from, but you are becoming a real pest!" he growled. "I remember my cousin underestimating a colony of ants like this. But I won't make his mistake, mind. Flies like you are only good for one thing - and that's SQUISHING! I'm gonna squish you like the puny insect you are!!!"

Matt was furious. what did he do?
1442112221.title: Matt pushes the exterminator's boot over

14421122212.content:
it was then as Justin felt an incredibly sharp pain in his finger. Matt the fly had bit it. Hard!

"YOW!" Justin screamed in pain.

Matt gulped. He hadn't meant to do it.

But now, what would happen next?
14421122212.title: Matt bites Justin

144211222122.content:
"Blood-sucking little pest," Justin growled angrily. "I'm going to enjoy squishing you!"

His huge eyes scanned for the tiny, flying insect.

Matt, hearing Justin's words, realized he had made a serious mistake and tried to put distance between them.

He hadn't managed to fly far when Justin heard the droning buzz and smiled. "You can't hide, you little fucker."

Matt had other ideas....
144211222122.title: Payback

1442112222.content:
Until now, Matt had lacked any appreciation of the way the universe must appear to a bug.

For tiny ants or flies, everything is, more or less, monumental. At the moment, the scale of his surroundings was overwhelming as he tried to crawl what would have been a short distance any other time.

If the exterminator hadn't blasted him with that wretched insecticide, his wings would help compensate for his lack of size by at least making him more mobile.

The giant man's boots continue to descend the steps, and Matt gains additional motivation to move when the shadow of one of the huge boots overtakes him.

Before the boot slams home, he manages to crawl over the ledge of the concrete step, tumbling hard to the step below it.

There's no time to celebrate a minor victory as he hears the exterminator curse loudly and prepare to try again to squish the pest.

"Wait! I'm not a real bug!" Matt tries to scream. He had fallen onto his back, and he can feel his wings buzz beneath him as his six legs twitch without effect as he tries to right himself.

Of course, he only produced a buzzing noise, not even close to actual words.

Justin stared down, saw the pesky fly had landed, like an overturned tortoise, on its back and put an end to its attempt to escape its fate.

Matt had an instant to ponder how unfair it is, from a bug's perspective, when the final shoe drops.

Even more unfair if you happen to be a brilliant, precocious scientific mind…

Poor Matt, only able to watch as the heavy tread of the underside of the massive boot crashed down, screamed one final "No!"

After stomping on the fly, then grinding his boot back and forth on the concrete step for good measure, Justin continued with the rest of the pest control visit.

He never suspected he had wiped out a member of the household. In the room in the basement, he saw Matt's bottle of antidote, never realizing how a closed door had prevented Matt from reaching the formula that was only a few feet away from where the huge exterminator had brought his destructive boot down with such lethal consequences.
1442112222.title: Squashed

144212.content:
Matt decided to stay in the house rather than risk something happening to his tiny fly body in the big outside world.

After all, he should be safe in his own house.

He remained on the wall, his six limbs securely attached to the vertical surface, and watched his sister and her friends leave the house.

Once they were gone, he flew around the room, getting more familiar with his new wings. Buzzing from place to place became boring quickly, and he settled on the coffee table next to a huge glass bowl that held the family's various keys.

He realized he felt hungry, which prompted Matt to debate what he should do next.

Should he fly into the kitchen and look for some food?

Or maybe he should fly upstairs to his room. Looking at his room and belongings might be rather cool. He might even figure out some means out of his dilemma.

What should he do?
144212.title: Waiting at Home

choices: Andy wants to swat him with comic book
Andy opens the window to shoo him out
1442122.content:
Matt buzzed upstairs and made his way inside his bedroom.

Everything now looked so huge! He flew in circles around the room and finally settled on the windowsill. From his perch, he could scan most of his room.

He had hoped something, anything, might help him solve his problem. How would he ever get back his human body without help?

He lifted into the air again and flew to his dresser. Landing on the flat surface, he stared into his mirror. Matt saw what he had become. He looked monstrous!

He didn't have long to dwell on those thoughts when he heard a noise.

Footsteps!? Someone coming upstairs.

Could Kellie and her friends be back already?

Matt flew into the air again an instant before his best friend walked into his bedroom.

"Matt!" Andy shouted. "You here?"

His friend looked so huge!

Andy wore a pair of tattered sneakers, baggy jeans and a red T-shirt. His shaggy head of light brown hair cascaded down around his face.

He buzzed toward his friend's face. He tried to scream for help, to shout Andy's name, but he couldn't produce any words.

Matt realized he could only produce a buzzing noise with his wings.

He flew closer to Andy, who looked absolutely colossal.

Andy's billboard face stared at him.

"Andy! Please, Andy! It's me!"

Matt hovered in front of Andy's face for more than a terrifying second.

Andy's immense voice boomed like some kind of god. "Stupid pest!" Andy exclaimed, raising a hand at swatting at the fly.

Matt saw the advancing hand and managed to fly out of range.

He flew across the room and settled on the window sill.

Matt could not believe his best friend had tried to swat him.

And it wasn't over.

Andy spied the tiny fly on the window sill.

He crossed the room, picking up one of Matt's comic books from a stack on a table.

"Andy! No!" Matt tried to plead.
1442122.title: A Visitor

choices: Crush Matt like the bug he had become...
Realize that the fly he had just de-winged was in fact his best friend!
14421221.content:
It was useless. No matter how hard he tried, Matt's voice wasn't able to reach Andy's ears. Matt immediately jumped into the air and began to fly away, but before he even knew what had hit him, he felt the rolled up comic book skimming against his underbelly. If he had taken off even a fraction of a second later, he would have undoubtedly been killed. While the friction did sting, he wasn't in any way incapacitated by the glancing blow.

Matt flew as fast as he could to try and escape, but he didn't get very far. Within seconds of the initial swing, Andy had swung at him once again. This time, Matt wasn't fortunate enough to escape with a mere friction-burn. The wadded up piece of literature slammed hard against his side, and sent him rocketing in the direction of his bed. Luckily, he landed on one of his pillows, so he had survived the crash.

As he prepared to fly away again, he realized that his left wing had been smashed by the impact. He was incapable of escaping now. A fly that couldn't fly was nothing more than a sitting duck. Just then, Andy dropped the comic book and walked over to Matt's location. Picking him up by his uninjured wing and dangling him in front of his face, Andy proceeded to...
14421221.title: Whoever said that books never hurt anyone... Lied!

choices: Try to get back inside the house
14421222.content:
Matt buzzed toward Andy's nose.

He tried to shout his friend's name, to ask for help, anything, but he could do nothing more than buzz his wings.

Andy pushed open the window. "Get out of here!" Andy said, waving his hand toward the irritating fly buzzing in his face.

"No!" Matt thought. "You can't do this..."

WHAP! Andy slammed the comic book toward him. "I don't wanna have to swat you," warned the giant teen.

Matt tried once more to fly past Andy.

But his friend swiped at him again with the comic book, which grazed the tiny fly and sent it rocketing out the open window.

Matt managed to regain control over his fly body. He flew back toward the window.

BANG!

He slammed into an invisible barrier.

Oh no! His friend had shut the window, locking him out of his own home! He looked through the glass and could see Andy walking around his room.
14421222.title: Evicted

144212221.content:
His mission.

Get back into his house and, hopefully, into his makeshift laboratory.

Not an imposing challenge unless, like Matt, one happens to be a teenage boy trapped as a tiny fly.

He buzzed around the outer wall of his home, diving down to the evergreen hedge bordering the wall. His surrounding looked enormous, the thick hedge resembling a deep and gloomy forest.

If he could not re-enter through his bedroom window, perhaps he could sneak inside through some other entrance.

He buzzed over the wide expanse of the redwood planks comprising the patio deck. Matt made a tricky maneuver, learning as he went that his tiny wings functioned perfectly well if he didn't concentrate too hard and simply let his insect instincts have control.

The buzzing of the wings, however, attracted the attention of another occupant of the backyard. Oblivious to the presence, Matt buzzed back and forth, scanning for an opening into the house. He adjusted his altitude and skimmed over the short grass of the backyard lawn.

Suddenly, his flight got rudely interrupted by...
144212221.title: Fly Away Home

1442122211.content:
"Aaah!" Matt tried to scream.

How did this monstrous beast get into the yard?

Of course, he viewed the creature from his meager viewpoint as a tiny insect, a mere fly.

Before his incredible transformation, the teen would have looked down at the small dog, totally unconcerned by the yelping of the animal at his heels.

Matt shot higher into the air and looked down at the family dog, Lucky, attracted by the noisy buzzing of the teen's little fly wings.

Suddenly, the dog leaped wildly into the air, slobbering jaws snapped closed, inches from Matt's tiny body.

He would have screamed if such a possibility existed.

"Dumb dog!" Matt thought. "Go away!"

Even as Matt tried to make his fly body leave the scene, the buzzing of his wings drove the dog to a frenzy of wild leaps and contortions.

"I've got to get higher," Matt realized. "I've got to..."

GAR-UMPH!!

The little dog felt a surge of triumph as its jaws closed around the hateful buzzing bug.

Lucky hated flies.

He growled as he continued to feel the insect's frantic struggles inside his canine jaws.

Lucky truly hated flies...
1442122211.title: Lucky

choices: Matt managed to hutch a ride inside
14421222112.content:
Matt determined not to be swallowed by a dog relentlessly buzzed his wings.

"No,no,no." He begged, trying his best to irritate the enormous tongue.

Miraculously the dog's mouth opened as he shook his head aggressively.

Matt's tiny fly body shot out, but was covered entirely in slobber. His wings far too heavy to fly.

As soon as he landed on the ground matt worked to get back on his six tiny feet. crawling as quickly as possible to distance himself from the giant monster.

The dog sniffed at the ground trying to find its tiny prey. Its flared black nostrils taking in massive amounts of air with each sniff.

"Go away!" Matt pleaded as he crawled towards the front door of his home.

Just as the dog's nose reached the tiny fly-boy's body a feminine voice rang out. "Shoo! Get out of here!"

Matt instantly recognized his mother's voice. "Mom! I'm down here" He shouted as the dog ran away as she approached.

Not looking towards the ground for a random fly, that might be her son Matt's mother readied her keys for the front door.

"Mom! Stop!" Matt screamed as her sandal clad sailed towards his tiny form.
14421222112.title: Lucky spits out the fly

choices: Took the sandal off in the foyer.
144212221121.content:
Matt crawled away as quickly as his slobber soaked body would allow. He hadn't made it more than an inch before his mother's foot slammed down.

The world froze for the fly boy as he knew for certain he was crushed. Matt was surrounded by pure darkness, and silence. There was a pressure from all sides.

Suddenly the world whirled back as the darkness and simultaneously shattered. Matt was being lifted high into the air.

The pressure surrounding Matt was caused by his tiny fly body being wedge between the thick treads of his mother's Ecco hiking sandals.

Matt screamed as his mother's foot landed as she casually walked to the front door. Unaware that her son was stuck in the tread of her favorite sandals.

The vibrations sent through Matt's body with each step threatened to liquefy his insides. The few moments of rest as the giantess unlocked the front door was a welcome, but short lived respite.

Matt's mother opened the door and stepped inside. After she closed the door she turned and...
144212221121.title: Matt is stepped on

1442122211211.content:
To Matt's horror his mother left her sandals on as she entered the house. As she moved casually towards the stairs Matt felt his wings tear off. "Mom! Stop!" He begged.

The few dozen steps it took for the unaware giantess to reach her bedroom were absolute hell for Matt. His body was pushed tightly into the tread preventing him from being crushed. All he could do was scream for his mother's attention.

Suddenly Matt felt like he was flying again. In reality his mother had flopped onto her bed. Her feet swung onto the bed and rested on their heels.

Matt could see the wall, and TV as his mom turned on Netflix. She relaxed into the pillows as she selected a movie to watch.

With much or the pressure released Matt began to wiggle in the rubber tread. It didn't seem to be working, but Matt was desperate. He couldn't give up. He didn't want to die, stuck under his mother's sandal.

After about half an hour his mother's feet began to shift. Wanting to relax more she say up and began unstrapping her sandals. Her hand wrapped around the sole as she prepared to pull it off.

Matt frantically wiggles desperately trying to tickle his mother's palm. To his shock she seemed to notice. After removing her sandal she glanced down at the treads. "Gross, I stepped on a bug." She said, spotting Matt.

"No, Mom! It's me! It's Matt. Help me!" Matt buzzed wildly.

The giantess' face contorted into a look of disgust with the realization the the bug was still alive. She turned the sandal over and smacked it into her palm several times. Her attempts to dislodge the bug failed.

Standing she walked over to her vanity and grabbed a pen. Using the point she roughly lodged it under the bug and popped it out.

With no wings Matt plummeted to the ground below. He called out to his mother for help even as she lifted her barefoot into the air.

She dropped her foot quickly, centering the bug under the rough ball of her foot. With a twist she felt the bug pop into paste.

Dragging her foot backwards across the rug as she moved back to the bed Matt's mother was ready to fully relax and enjoy the movie.
1442122211211.title: Left her sandals on.

choices: Matt's mom shrinks, but stays human.
1442122211212.content:
Matt could hear the sound of the velcro straps being pulled apart. His mother slid her feet out of the sandals relieving some pressure off of Matt's body. She pushed the sandals against the wall and left them.

Still lodged, but not nearly as tightly Matt began to wiggle in the sandal's tread. His battered body finally slid out from under the sandal. Exhausted and out of energy Matt wanted to pass out.

"Matt ?" His mother called. "Are you home ?"

Hearing her call for him Matt pushed himself back into the air. He saw his giant mother opening the basement door. He followed in behind her as moved down the stairs.

Matt kept his distance to avoid being spotted. He watched as his mom looked around his lab. He saw his antidote on the table still. With unequaled determination he flew straight for it.

"What are you up to down here Matt ?" His mother wondered aloud. As she did she spotted a small fly hovering near a jar of blue liquid.

Matt was ready to drop into the antidote, instead he felt the back of his mother's hand. Matt landed on the table a few feet away. "Mom, no!" He screamed as she raised his antidote from the table.

Holding it to her nose Matt's mom inhale the strange blue liquid's scent. "It smells strange." She said before she put the jar to her lips out of curiosity.

Matt took back to the sky fueled by desperation. He had no idea what effect the antidote would have on his mother. Unfortunately he was too slow. She had already taken a large sip of the liquid.

"Gross!" She said placing the jar back on table. She saw the same pestering fly coming back towards the jar.

She shooed the fly again, but it was annoyingly persistent. "This stuff is driving the flies crazy." She said grabbing the jar from the table again, and moving towards the sink.

"Mom! Wait!" Matt screamed giving chase.

As a fly he was powerless to stop her as she casually poured the antidote out. He desperately landed in the sink and tried to drink up the antidote as it swirled the drain.

The giantess saw the crazed fly desperately trying to drink up the blue liquid. callously she opened up the tap full blast the wash the rest of the liquid and the fly down the drain.

Matt screamed as he was swept in a torrent down the long dark drain. Water surrounded him as he moved uncontrollably through the pipes.

Matt's mom walked back upstairs. She was suddenly not feeling well. She regretted taking a sip of a random jar of liquid in Matt's lab.
1442122211212.title: Took the sandal off in the foyer.

choices: Follow Matt's journey down the drain.
14421222112121.content:
Matt's mom Anne was beginning to feel extremely ill. "I'm such a idiot." She said cursing herself for drinking a random liquid from Matt's lab.

Trudging forward Anne saw Kellie's discarded soccer cleats in the middle of the walkway. As she bent down to grab them she felt faint. Her vision darkened and she suddenly had the sensation of falling.

From her hands and knees Anne could tell something was wrong. The air was incredibly hot, and damp. There was a stench that seemed familiar.

Pushing to her feet Anne audibly gasped. "Oh my God." She whispered under her breath.

Her heart pounded loudly in her chest. Somehow she had shrank down to only half an inch tall. She quickly noticed her clothes hadn't shrank with her

Worse than that she had fallen into one of Kellie's cleats. The moist stench in the air was swear from her daughter's feet.

Anne tried calm herself, tried to think clearly. She knew this was because of the liquid she drank. Her genius son was her best bet for returning to normal. She just had to figure out how to get his attention.

As she took a step forward her feet squished on the moist insole. Before anything she had to get out of Kellie's cleat.

The sound of the front door opening echoed through the cleat. Anne didn't have to speculate about who had just come in. The footfalls and chattering of three teenage girls was all she needed to know.

"Kellie!" She said under her breath.

Every footfall radiated through Anne's tiny body. She moved quickly to try to climb out. Kellie wasn't likely to put the cleats on, but Anne had no desire to stay inside her daughter's cleat any longer than she had to.

"Wow, you leave your stuff laying around everywhere." Samantha said stopping next to the pile of clothes, and cleats.

Anne's progress was halted as Samantha nudged the cleat with her foot. She fell back into the well worn heel cup below.

"Hey! Only the cleats are mine!" Kellie protested. "The rest looks like Mom's. I have no idea why she left them laying around."

As Anne got back to her feet Kellie gathered up her clothes. Anne stumbled backwards as enormous fingers fell into the cleat. Before she could brace herself the cleat was pulled into the air. Falling back into the toe section Anne held on tightly as Kellie walked.

Kellie dropped her mom's clothes off in the laundry room. She then carried her cleats with her into her bedroom. As she entered she carelessly toss them.......
14421222112121.title: Matt's mom shrinks, but stays human.

144212221121212.content:
Anne felt a moment of weightlessness as the cleats flew through the air. Upon impact she was tossed violently in every direction as they tumbled across the floor. Her body was thrown from the shoe and out onto the open floor.

Out of breath and sore Anne couldn't brace for Julie's barefoot to land next to her. Almost as quickly as she was nearly crushed the foot rose and left. Pushing to her feet she attempted to run, but was blocked by Samantha.

The towering teen's toes landed in front of her. In a panic she turned and ran towards the discarded cleats. What she didn't realize is Kellie noticed something entering her shoe.

A moment after she entered the shoe was knocked onto its sole. Kellie appeared above it with a curious look in her eye. "I think there's a bug in my cleat." She said.

Samantha laughed. "Poor thing. It's going to suffocate in there."

"This proves you need new cleats now Kels" Julie said giggling.

"You two are just so funny!" She said lifting the cleat from the ground.

Turning the cleat over she shakes it dumping out.....
144212221121212.title: On the floor.

1442122211212123.content:
When nothing falls out Kellie smacks the side of the cleat several times. Inside Anne had wedged herself under the insole. It was putrid, and still wet with sweat. But, kellie couldn't see her, even as she peered inside.

"Strange, I could have swore I saw something run inside." Kellie said shaking the shoe one last time.

Julie just shrugged. "Guess you're just seeing things. So what's our plan for today?" She asked.

Kellie unceremoniously dropped the cleat onto the floor before walking over to her bed. "I don't know. What are you guys up for ?" She said, flopping onto the edge of the bed.

"How about we hit up the pool ?" Samantha suggested.

While the teens continued their discussion Anne slipped out from under the insole. Thankfully the shoe landed on its side. Anne made her way to the opening and peered out. She desperately didn't want to be spotted again.

"We could always play soccer." Kellie suggested looking down at her cleats.

Anne froze, still standing on the inside of the shoe she could practically feel her daughter's gaze.

"That could be fun!" Julie said with a grin.

Samantha groaned. "You always want to play soccer."

Kellie stood and moved back to her cleats. Anne yelped as her daughter's barefoot appeared in front of her. With a casual motion she knocked the cleat back upright. Anne tumbled along the moist insole.

"Sounds like it's two against one Sam." Kellie said, dropping her bare toes into the opening of her cleat.

Anne screamed out in terror. "Kellie! Stop! I'm in here!"

Kellie toyed with the cleat, tipping it backwards with her toes. Anne was sent sliding until she slammed into her daughter's pudgy digits. Kellie thought she felt something but ignored it.

"You're the deciding vote Julie. What are we doing ?" Kellie asked while absentmindedly sprawling her toes.

Anne rolled under the raised toes until they fell down around her like a fleshy cage. "Kellie! Please!" She screamed.

Julie finally decided. "Well, I guess we going to.....
1442122211212123.title: Nothing.

choices: Anne uses the distraction to escape.
14421222112121231.content:
Anne's heart dropped when Julie decides on soccer. Kellie's foot pulled out of the cleat quickly leaving Anne to tumble roughly down the insole. Before she even came to a stop Kellie snatched the cleats up from the ground. Kellie tossed the shoes onto her bed, shaking her mom around violently.

"Ugh, fine." Samantha groaned. "You know you're way to obsessed right ?

Kellie just shrugged as she grabbed a different pair of shorts to wear. "You don't stay good by not practicing." She said.

Typically Anne was very proud of her daughter's dedication to the game. Unfortunately now she wished she'd just go to the movies, play a video game, go eat unhealthy foods, anything but play soccer. Her drive to always get better might just be Anne's undoing.

Anne managed to push back to her feet. She moved quickly down the moist insole towards the opening. she was exhausted and sore beyond reason. Grasping the fabric she tried to begin a climb to safety.

Kellie flopped down on the bed and grabbed the cleat she was trapped in. Somehow she kept her grip and desperately tried to finish the climb. As the cleat lowered towards her foot Samantha interjected. "You're not going wear those barefoot are you ?"

Kellie hesitated for a moment before....
14421222112121231.title: Play soccer

choices: Recognizes her mom (keeps it a secret)
Thinks her mom is just a word bug.
144212221121212313.content:
Kellie hesitated for a moment as Samantha's question. Immediately seizing the opportunity Anne scrambled up the back of the shoe. Without a second thought she jumped from the shoe to the floor below. She landed with a small plop right next to Kellie's barefoot.

She laid there for a moment before hearing Samantha speak again, this time her voice higher pitched. "Something just jumped out of your shoe!"

Anne looked up to see Kellie staring down at her. "I told you I saw something go inside my cleat!" She yelled.

Desperately Anne pushed to her feet to run away. She loved her daughter, but had no interest being found by her like this. Especially not when her friends were around. She was cut off mid stride by Kellie's big toe.

"Shit!" She said as her daughter's foot dropped in front of her. An instant later Kellie struck out with a kick sending her tiny mother out into the room. Anne groaned in pain as she rolled onto her back. Samantha's soles hovered above her before plummeting towards the ground

"Wait! I want to see what it is!" Kellie yelled, causing Samantha's foot to crash down just beside Anne.

A moment later Kellie was on top of Anne with a plastic cup. She knelt down and roughly scooped up her tiny mother. Anne stared upward, her entire vision was the eyes of three often immature teenage girls.

Staring down at the ting creature in the cup Kellie .....
144212221121212313.title: Anne uses the distraction to escape.

choices: We go play soccer as planned.
1442122211212123131.content:
As Anne saw the realization flash in Kellie's eyes she wasn't filled with relief. She loved her daughter very much, but being in this state gave her such a bad feeling. She could only pray that her daughter had the maturity to handle this situation.

"Oh my God, you guys! It's my mom!" Kellie blurted out, without hesitation.

"No way!" Julie said, peering inside the cup.

"Holy shit, you're right!" Samantha said with a slight grin.

Anne just sat in the cup staring up at her three teenage handlers. She focused on controlling her breathing, and not panicking. "Everything is going to be fine." She told herself. "Kellie will find Matt. He will fix you." She repeated over and over.

"How on earth could this happen?" Julie asked.

Kellie shrugged, jostling the cup slightly. "She probably got into something in Matt's lab. He works on all kinda of weird stuff down there." She said nonchalantly.

Samantha leaned in closer, still wearing a slight grin. "Sorry bout almost stepping on your mom." She said, unconvincingly.

Again Kellie just shrugged. "She's the one running around on the floor like a dumbass." Kellie said. "And hiding in my soccer cleat like a bug."

Kellie's uncaring words sent a chill down Anne's spine. She was losing hope by the second that her daughter was going to be of any help. "Kellie, you have to find Matt!" She shouted up.

"I think she's trying to say something." Julie pointed out.

Kellie rolled her eyes dismissively. "I don't care. She's not in charge anymore."

"So you're not going to help her at all?" Julie asked, submissively, waiting for her her friend's lead.

"Why should I?" Kellie asked with an uncaring tone.

"Because she's your mom." Julie answered softly.

"Not anymore. Now she's just a tiny bug." Kellie said coldly, staring straight through Anne.

Anne was completely trembling inside the cup. She heard the conversation, but couldn't believe it. She worried Kellie would be immature about her shrinking, but she never imagined this. "Kellie, this isn't funny! You have to help me!" She screamed up, still hoping this was her daughter's terrible sense of humor.

"So, what are you going to do with her?" Samantha asked eagerly.

With a smirk Kellie callously dumped her tiny mother onto the carpet below. "First things first, I think.....
1442122211212123131.title: Recognizes her mom (tells her friends)

choices: We find what made her tiny.
14421222112121231311.content:
Before Anne could recover Kellie's powerful toes dropped onto her prone body. The giantess clenched her toes to hold her prey as she walked back to her bed. "I do think I'll wear socks though." Kellie said, grabbing a pair if long black socks from the floor.

"We're still going to play soccer?" Julie asked as she looked down at Anne writhing under Kellie's toes.

"Of course," Kellie said, pulling the sock over her foot, trapping Anne. "Why wouldn't we."

Anne felt the heat and humidity increase instantly as Kellie slipped her foot into her cleat. She remembered she always got on to Kellie for wearing her cleats inside. Now she was no longer in the position to get onto her daughter for anything.

Kellie began to casually walk as if she didn't have her mother trapped under her toes. The tiny woman's body was shifted constantly with each pounding step. She grasped on to rope sized cotton strands to keep from slipping further under Kellie's foot.

The walk to the soccer field was unfortunately a short one. Before long Kellie began to run. The massive impacts shaking Anne to her core. Her grip quickly failed her. Despite her efforts Anne slid under the ball of Kellie's foot. If her daughter noticed the change, she didn't care.

Anne expected to be snuffed out instantly, instead she remained intact. Somehow her tiny form withstood the assault. As the sweat oozed from Kellie's sole Anne questioned if surviving was a blessing. Gagging the ting mother tried not to swallow her daughters foot funk.

The time under Kellie's foot seemed to be endless. Anne had no sense of how long she had been trapped. All she knew was the repeated booms of Kellie kicking a soccer ball as she ran.

Mercifully though the play finally stopped. The casual walk home was almost a relief to Anne. Her daughters steps seemed like gentle whispers in comparison.

Once home Kellie kicked her cleats off at the door, leaving her sweat soaked socks on. She padded cheerfully to her bedroom. After flopping onto her bed she began to slowly peel the socks off.

Anne felt the heavy cotton pulling away from her splayed body. To her humiliation, and Kellie's amusement she was left plastered to her daughter's sole. "Wow, you're a tough little bug." Kellie said as she roughly picked her mom off her foot.

"I can't believe she made it." Samantha said laughing.

"Do you think that whatever shrunk her, made her super durable?" Julie asked, her eyes fixated on the tiny woman.

Kellie just shrugged. "I don't know. Maybe. Looks we get spend even more quality time together, mom." Kellie said, putting emphasis on the last word.

"So what are you going to do to her now ?" Samantha asked with morbid curiosity.

Kellie grinned devilishly. "How about....
14421222112121231311.title: We go play soccer as planned.

choices: Sister Joan, and niece Becky walked in.
Her husband, and Mother-in-law Helen enter.
14421222112122.content:
Unfortunately for Matt's mom Anne the antidote was only an antidote if you had already taken the shrinking formula. Taking one without the other was tantamount to taking anti-venom without being snake bit. The effects had already began to take hold as Anne padded towards the living room.

A wave of dizziness swept over the unsuspecting mother. In mid step she was suddenly falling through the air. In a literal instant she went from fullsize to struggling to crawl out of her circus tent sized shirt.

She quickly realized that in addition to inexplicably shrinking her body had began to transform. Moving into the open Anne discovered that she had become a small, fuzzy, eight legged spider. "Oh my God!" She screamed in panic, her voice echoing inside her head.

She knew that this was because of the strange liquid from Matt's lab. If she was ever going to return to normal she had to find a way to get help. She had to get back into the lab, and hope Matt left a way to reserve her transformation.

As Anne scurried across the open floor as quickly as her right legs would take her the front door swung open. Anne froze as her....
14421222112122.title: Matt's mom becomes an insect.

choices: Andy leaves the house by the backdoor
144212222.content:
Anyone with a sharp eye would have seen nothing more than a little fly perched on a twig in a green hedge bordering a two-story home.

That's what anyone would have seen because who expects that the aforementioned fly was, before his own science experiment malfunctioned, a teenaged boy.

Matt remained hidden in the dense foliage of the hedge, reluctant to leave the shelter even to look for a way to return inside his home.

The scary memory of that monstrous bird, in reality a small but hungry sparrow, remained seared in his mind.

The frightening bird came out of nowhere while Matt had been buzzing near his bedroom window, looking for another way inside his home after being ejected by his best friend.

If he hadn't dived into the thick hedge, the awful bird would have gobbled him up in one snap of its beak.

"I've got to get inside the house and back to my lab," Matt thought. "It's too dangerous out here."

He considered flying to the back door and searching for an entry. He felt nervous, wondering what other unexpected perils might threaten a tiny fly.
144212222.title: Big Bad World

14422.content:
Matt felt very low even as he hovered near his sister's huge head.

"Kellie, no," he thought as he realized she had blocked his return to the basement.

"Come on," Kellie told her friends. "We'll go get something to eat and maybe Matt will be back when we return."

Matt tried to think fast. He buzzed toward Kellie's ear. "You can't just leave me here like this!"

His sister felt him buzzing near her face. She brought a huge hand up and swatted at him. "Shoo!" Kellie said irritably.

Her second swat grazed him and sent him spinning toward the floor, but he pulled out of his dive before hitting the hard floor.

By the time he regained some elevation, he saw Kellie open the door for her friends.

Julie and Samantha stepped outside the house.

Matt wondered if he should fly outdoors and continue trying to get help from Kellie and her friends.

Or should he stay in the house and wait for them to get back?
14422.title: Buzzing Around

144221.content:
Matt had a bit of a crush on Julie, but she barely tolerated him as a human. He didn't want to think what she could be capable of doing to a fly.

Samantha liked him, but he didn't feel the same about her.

As for his sister. He got along with Kellie as well as could be expected of two such opposite-minded siblings.

Matt needed to count on Kellie and her friends. He didn't see any way of getting back to normal without their help.


He hoped that, with enough time to study the clues, Kellie or one of her friends would figure out what had happened and recognize him.

Matt decided he would wait inside his home for them to return. While he waited, he could think of ways to communicate with them.

He watched as his huge sister and her friends left. "Maybe Matt will be here when we get back," she said as they left.

He flew to a perch on the upper rim of a framed picture hanging on the wall.

After all, he should be safe, even as a tiny fly, in his own house.
144221.title: Biding his Time

1442211.content:
Matt flew into the kitchen. He buzzed over the enormous table and flew in front of the cabinets.

As he approached the windowsill, he noticed some of his mother's potted plants. The plants looked as big as trees!

He also noticed a new plant among the collection. Several green flowers on the end of long stems opened to reveal a bright red interior fringed by a row of spiky green teeth.

The odd-looking plant seemed familiar.

At that moment, Matt's keen fly senses detected a powerful and overwhelming odor that seemed to come from the plant.

The scent kicked his fly instincts into over-drive!

He flew closer to the plant. Through his foggy brain, he tried to figure out why the plant looked so familiar.
1442211.title: Kitchen Discovery

14422111.content:
Matt studied the green and red blooms. They looked huge but familiar. He suddenly recognized the blooms from photos he had seen in a biology textbook.

"It's a flytrap!" Matt exclaimed. He knew he needed to keep away.

About that time the fly instincts resurfaced, drawn by the aroma of the Venus flytrap.

The fly flew closer.

Matt tried to scream in protest.

The fly landed on a fleshy red pad.

"Get away!" Matt cried.

The green fringe of the trap sprang closed around Matt's fly body.

"Oh no!" Matt cried as he felt the trap squeeze tighter as he struggled.

Was he really going to be eaten by a plant?
14422111.title: Venus flytrap

choices: Inside the Wendy's across the street
144222.content:
As Samantha and Julie stepped outside, Matt impulsively raced for the open door. Only when he was within a few feet of it did he begin to have second thoughts. It would be much harder to make contact with the girls outside, and he could end up trapped there just like he had been forced out of the basement.

As he began to turn around, Kellie, seeing the fly so close to the doorway, picked up a magazine and swung it at Matt from behind. A huge gust of wind carried Matt's tiny body through the doorway, and before he could recover Kellie had stepped out and slammed the door shut, leaving him stuck outside.

The outside world had a strange effect on Matt. During the transformation, he had acquired the ability to control the body of a fly. Now his body was beginning to take control of him. His memories faded and were replaced with the drives of a fly.

About five minutes passed before Matt regained self-awareness. He found himself....
144222.title: Outside

1442221.content:
Matt needed a moment.

"Where am I?" He saw a huge counter with cash registers and a large menu board.

"I'm at Wendy's." He wondered how he had gotten here. Matt remembered shrinking and then changing into a fly. He remembered being evicted from the house when Kellie had slapped at him with a magazine. But he could not remember getting from his home to the restaurant.

If he had known of the missing interval in his memory, he might have been upset by some of his detours, including his joining a swarm of other flies near a smelly trash container behind the restaurant.

He had flown inside the restaurant when someone opened a door and the swarm scattered. Matt ended up flying around the dining room before he regained his memory.

While he buzzed around near the ceiling, Matt began to look for his sister and her friends.

He finally saw the giant girls at:
1442221.title: In the restaurant

choices: Matt gets diverted from his goal
14422211.content:
By buzzing around the crowded restaurant, Matt located his sister and her friends, Julie and Samantha. The girls were seated at a booth in the restaurant, having already ordered some food and drinks.

They looked so huge. His nerve wavered. How could he ever get their attention? Wouldn't they see only an irritating pest? A fly to be swatted away?

He had to try. He changed direction and flew toward the huge table.

"I'm sure Matt can help us," Kellie was telling her friends. "If he ever shows up."

Matt wondered what they wanted with him.

"I hope he shows up soon," Julie said.

"The project's due in two days!" Samantha added.

That sounded familiar. Kellie and her friends always came to him with help on their class assignments.

As Matt buzzed above the table, the odors of the fast food kept bringing his fly urges to the forefront of his mind.

Just as he began flying lower toward the table, his fly drives took over completely.
14422211.title: Trying Again

choices: The girls head to the pool
The girls head back to the basement
144222111.content:
As the three girls talked, a fly landed in the middle of their table. It hopped onto Julie's tray as she was taking a bite out of her hamburger. Kellie brushed the insect away and it promptly circled and landed next to her fries. She waved her hand at it a second time and it took off across the restaurant.

She wondered where Matt could be. He was probably just off doing something with his friend Andy. Still, it was unlike him to leave without saying where he was going. It was really unlike him to leave his clothes in the middle of the basement....

Her mind drifted back to what she thought she had seen on the basement floor. "Girls, did that fly we saw in the basement.... did it look a little weird to you at first?"

Samantha emptied her shake, making a loud sucking noise "What fly?"

"You know, the one that we saw near Matt's clothes. It buzzed around us and you shooed it out of the basement."

"I did?"

"Yes, you moron" Julie interjected "it happened, like fifteen minutes ago. Don't you remember?"

"So I shooed it away. Why would I remember something dumb like that?"

"Stop it, you two!" said Kelly "The point is I.. I want to see if we can figure out what Matt was doing down there. He had all his stuff out like he was working on a project or something. It's just real strange that he wasn't there."

"Maybe he made himself invisible" Samantha exclaimed "and took his clothes off so we wouldn't see him!" She seemed rather pleased at the thought. Julie nearly choked.

"Lets go back to my place and look in the basement again" said Kellie.

"Let's go to the pool and forget about the project" said Julie, "your brother's lab always gives me the creeps."

As the three got up and walked out of the building, they didn't notice the tiny fly that zipped out the door after them.
144222111.title: Desicions

choices: Land on one of her friends
1442221111.content:
Matt found his tiny wings soon tired as he attempted to keep pace with his enormous sister and her gigantic friends.

They had gathered outside the restaurant long enough to decide to visit the local swimming pool.

Matt did his best to follow them, but they moved so quickly.

Desperate not to be left alone as a tiny, defenseless fly, he decided his best option might be to hitch a ride.

His only decision was whether he should park himself on his sister or one of her friends.
1442221111.title: To the Pool

14422211112.content: Which friend does he land on?
14422211112.title: Land on one of her friends

144222111121.content: Matt always had abit of a crush on Julie. Her tanned body never failed to get him hard just at the sight of it. This was his chance to get up close and personal. Matt begins to fly towards the giant Julie (who is at the front of the group) he flys around the other friends neck and then under Kellys armpit until he lands on Julies lower back, which is partially exposed due to Julies fondness for shirts that are slightly too small for her. Matt proceeds to crawl up Julies back until he makes it to the bare skin of her upper back, just below her neck. Julies dirty blonde hair almost completely blocks out the sun, but some sunlight was making it through her hair folicles and shined up her skin. Matt was in complete turn on mode. He was a fly, on the back of the hottest girl he knew. Ofcourse there was so much more of Julie to explore. He could remain on her upper body (where she is wearing a blue tanktop with a sky pattern) . Or he could fly onto her lower body (where she is wearing jean short shorts and a black leather belt, with some of her belly exposed).
144222111121.title: Julie

1442221112.content:
The three girls exited the restaurant and headed back across the street to Matt and Kellie's house. Kellie opened the door and let her friends in. Matt had barely enough time to squeeze through the door before it slammed shut. The boy turned fly buzzed up to the ceiling and watched the girls approach the door to his lab. Would they be able to figure out what had happened to him?

Kellie went over to the basement door and opened it up. "Matt, are you down here?" she called.

Hearing no response, Kellie and Samantha went down the stairs to Matt's lab. "If he's not down there we're going to the pool, right?" said Julie, from the top of the stairs. "Sure, whatever" Kellie said as she gazed around Matt's lab.

Matt's computer was on, but the screen had switched off from inactivity. Kellie moved the mouse and the screen flashed on, revealing Matt's desktop. She saw an e-mail from Andy, but it was nothing important.

She shifted her attention to Matt's work bench. A jar of pale blue liquid was resting on the table, next to Matt's tape recorder. An empty jar was on the floor containing the remnants of some kind of red liquid.

Samantha picked up the empty container of red liquid and wrinkled her nose. "What do you suppose this stuff was?" she asked. "I don't know, don't touch it, it could be poisonous" said Kelly. She picked up the tape recorder and pushed "play". The tape stopped abruptly. It must have been left to run until it got to the end. She hit rewind and waited as the tape wound back.

Meanwhile, Samantha stared at the empty red jar. She could see lip marks around the edge. Matt must have drunk it. She ran her finger across the bottom, collecting some of the red liquid on her finger tip....
1442221112.title: Back in the lab....

14422211121.content:
Matt's sister finished rewinding the tape, oblivious to the small fly buzzing near the ceiling of the lab.

At the same time, Samantha stared at the drop of red residue on her fingertip. She had collected the sample from the bottom of the nearly empty jar.

As she looked at the drop of red liquid, a fly buzzed frantically around her fingertip.

Kellie pressed the recorder's play button. After a moment of silence, she heard her brother's voice. He sounded almost breathless with anticipation.

“I am proceeding with the experiment. Earlier successes have led me to believe it is time I test the formula on myself.”

Matt heard his voice on the tape and stopped buzzing around Samantha's fingertip. He hovered in the air. Please, he thought, they must figure it out. He didn't want to remain a fly.

The sound of someone swallowing could be heard on the recording. Matt recalled how he had chugged the formula.

Kellie and her friends listened to Matt's definitely excited voice. “If I am correct, I should feel the effects begin almost...”

They heard a strangled little gasp and then, nothing!

"Is that all?" Julie asked.

Kellie experimented by fast-forwarding the tape. Each stop played only dead air.

"I guess so," Kellie said.

"Good," Julie said. "Can we please go to the pool now?"

Kellie considered. So far, she still hadn't been able to uncover Matt's secret, but she did have confirmation he had been working on something.

"Shoo!" Samantha exclaimed in an aggravated voice. The fly had returned its attention to her fingertip. She slapped at the fly.

She succeeded and sent the tiny fly spinning away from her.

She decided to:
14422211121.title: Investigating

144222111211.content:
Samantha moved over to the sink in the corner of the basement and began washing her hands. Julie wrinkled her nose as she turned her attention to the jar of liquid on the tabletop, "Kellie, that stuff your brother left on the table smells. Do you think we should just leave it there?"

Kellie gazed at the blue liquid. Matt might be unwilling to help on their project if she ruined one of his experiments. On the other hand, the stuff did smell quite a bit. Maybe she should dump it....
144222111211.title: The fate of the antidote....

1442221112111.content:
Matt had been temporarily stunned after being swatted by Samantha. Now his world sprang sharply back into focus. His sister and her two friends had congregated around the table. Kellie was holding a glass in her hand, a glass containing blue liquid that Matt recognized as the antidote.

Matt had been shocked to discover his formula had changed him into a fly. To this point he had never imagined it would be anything but temporary. If Kellie dumped the antidote, he would be a fly forever!

Kellie began walking toward the sink, obviously intent on dumping his salvation down the drain. "NO, PLEASE! KELLIE STOP!" Matt tried desperately to scream as he flew toward his now giant sister.

Suddenly, from out of nowhere, a huge wall of plastic passed in front of him, blocking his path. It took Matt a moment to realize he was trapped inside a clear plastic container of some sort. Julie brought her hand down over the top of the plastic cup she had used to trap the annoying fly. "Finally caught the pest..." she said with satisfaction. Finding a plastic cap for the cup, she snapped it on and gazed at her captive. From across the room, the sound of gurgling liquid could be heard as Kellie rinsed the last of the antidote down the drain.

Matt stared through the walls of his prison, helpless to intervene. He had hoped to become a famous inventor, instead, he had just become the first person turned permanently into a bug.

Julie gazed down at the fly in the cup. It had almost appeared to be watching Kellie pour the liquid away. She looked over at Matt's clothes, then the tape recorder, and finally towards Kellie, who was returning from the sink. "Kellie", she said, her face slightly pale, "I think I know what happened to your brother."
1442221112111.title: A Bug Forever?

choices: Keep the fly in the cup
14422211121111.content:
"Well, don't keep us in suspense," Kellie said.

Julie held the plastic cup to her face. She stared at the tiny fly.

"Matt?" Julie whispered.

Matt felt his excitement increase. Had Julie really figured out the mystery?

At that instant, however, his mind began to grow fuzzy. His fly instincts began to re-assert themselves.

Kellie crossed the room. "We're waiting," she said. "What's your breakthrough?"

"It is going to sound crazy," Julie said.

"Haven't we wasted enough time?" Samantha asked irritably. "Let's go to the pool."

"Give me a second," Julie said. "I think that Matt must have changed himself into a fly."

Samantha and Kellie stared at her.

Samantha burst out laughing. "You've flipped!"

"Yeah, that's a pretty far-out theory, Julie," Kellie agreed.

"But we found that fly on your brother's clothes!" Julie argued.

"So?" Kellie asked.

"When we went to his lab, and I saw something on the floor, well, it looked sort of strange. Looking back..."

"Why would even someone as strange as Matt intentionally turn himself into a fly?" Samantha asked, obviously unimpressed.

Kellie agreed. "Yeah, I don't think Matt's experiments would have involved that."

"Well, let's ask him," Julie said. She stared at the fly. "Ok, if you're really Matt, fly to the bottom of the cup."

The tiny fly remained on the side of the plastic cup.

"Go ahead," Julie said, looking a little embarrassed. "Fly to the bottom of the cup, Matt."

"I've had enough of this nonsense," Samantha declared.

Julie looked disappointed. "I guess it really is just a fly," she said, although she remembered how it had almost seemed the little fly wanted to stop Kellie from dumping the smelly blue liquid.
14422211121111.title: Trying to Prove Her Theory

choices: Land on a garden gnome statue

"I've had enough of this nonsense," Samantha declared.

Julie looked disappointed.

"I guess it really is just a stupid fly," she said. "But, for a moment, it really looked like the little fly wanted Kellie not to dump that awful blue stuff."

Your wings buzz furiously. You cannot believe Julie was smart enough to figure it out, but nobody believes her.

Kellie had turned on the faucet to rinse the last of the foul-smelling liquid down the drain. "Well, I don't think even that little pest minds that I got rid of that stinky stuff," she said.

"No…no ooh!" Matt objects. Did she have to be so thorough. There's not even a drop of the antidote left.

"Might as well let it go," Julie says with another glance at the fly imprisoned in the plastic cup.

But she moved too quickly, and he had little experience of wind while flying. Gusts of wind shook the nearby trees and caused the flowers in the garden to sway.

The powerful wind also prevented him from flying after her. He was forced to...
144222111211111.title: Freed

Julie gazed at the little fly she had captured. As she watched it buzz frantically against the wall of the cup, she couldn't shake the feeling that the creature she was watching was actually Kellie's transformed brother.

She couldn't imagine why Matt would want to turn himself into a bug. The possibility that his transformation was an accident had not yet occurred to her. She did realize, however, that as long as Matt remained secure in her clutches, he might not have any means of changing back.

With a tiny smile, she quietly slipped the cup in her bag and zipped it shut. One way or another, she would get to the bottom of this....

As Matt regained self awareness, he found himself in total darkness. The gradual perception that he was not wearing any clothes, and the strange sensation of wings on his back quickly reminded him of his current state. As the events following his transformation seeped back into his memory, he trembled at the last clear vision he had seen, of his sister Kellie, standing over the sink with the empty bottle of antidote.

His thoughts were interrupted as the ground shifted abruptly. He heard the sound of a book bag zipper being opened, and sunlight streamed in from above, illuminating his plastic prison. As Matt gazed upward, he realized he was in....
