The tiny flyboy gazed upward and was able to see bright sunlight, as well as hear various splashing sounds. He figured that Julie had taken him into a changing room at the pool. A massive yet delicate hand reached into the bag and grabbed the cup containing Matt, in all his...whatever quality an insect has...raising it toward her face.

"I wish I could know for sure..." Julie sighed as she watched the fly continue buzzing against the plastic walls of his prison. "Matt, if it's you...bang on the wall toward me."

The bug complied, bashing on the plastic in the giantess's direction twice. "Matt...it's really you! I can't believe it..."

With a soft smile, Julie opens the cup...
1442221112111121.title: Establishing Communications

14422211121111212.content:
Matt's heart filled with joy and hope as his captor removed the lid from his plastic prison...but that joy and hope were quickly replaced with dread and despair when Julie walked to a nearby water fountain, filling the cup almost completely, and nearly drowning the little flyboy.

"Well, Matt..." Julie spoke, "...sorry about this, but I can't let my friends know anything about your situation. They probably wouldn't buy a word of it, anyway!"

The bug wasn't initially sure he knew what Julie was talking about, but he had a pretty good idea that he wouldn't like it. The titaness tilted the cup so that the rim made contact with her parting lips, and she slowly began to sip the water. Unable to flutter his soaked wings or even use his feeble legs to fight the current, Matt was helplessly washed into Julie's mouth and down her throat with a quick gulp. If one looked close enough (which was unlikely), one might see a small lump thrashing pathetically as it slid down the giantess's neck.

Julie patted her stomach a few times, smiling. "He tasted pretty good...it's a shame I could only eat the little pest once."
14422211121111212.title: Down the hatch for Matt...

Matt squirmed and struggled the whole way down Julie’s throat, but he couldn’t stop himself from being squeezed all the way into her stomach, the sphincter above closing up to trap the little fly inside. He began to ram the fleshy walls of his prison, not prepared to be reduced to nutrients for a girl (even if it meant being closer to her).

On the outside, Julie felt a flutter coming from within her belly and put a hand to it. “Aww, poor Matt must be trying to get out of there! Not gonna work, little flyboy...” Suddenly the titaness flinched, starting to feel a little sick. Maybe Matt’s struggles for survival were the cause!

Could the bug actially have a chance here?
144222111211112121.title: Trying to Escape Digestion

Matt felt Julie's reaction, and immediately doubled his efforts. with all his energy his rammed everything he could. Getting the most response from targeting the sphincter he focused all of his efforts on it.

"Stop it, you little shit." Julie growled.

It was too much, and her body betrayed her. Julie dashed into the bathroom just in time for her sromahc to reject its contents.

Matt knew he had to be ready. The instant the sphincter opened he shot through it. The esophagus made way as he flew through.

With her mouth agape as she hastily lurched over the open toilet, Julie didn't notice the tiny fly boy making his escape.

Matt flew as quickly as he could out of the bathroom. The sounds of Julie throwing up echoing down the hall.

A door opened ahead of Matt. He nearly flew straight into the face of a 40 something year old woman. Matt could only presume it to be Julie's mother. She haphazardly swatted at him as she moved to investigate the sounds from the bathroom.

After deftly dodging her hand Matt continued through the house looking for an exit. Now, more than ever he desperately needed to get back to his lab.

Poor Matt was bounced into the bubbling lake of acid below, mercifully blacking out before he could feel the agonizing sting of digestion.

Was this really the end for Matt, though?
1442221112111121212.title: No Dice, Just Digestion

choices: Matt attempts to reach out with his mind
14422211121111212121.content:
For a long time Matt felt nothing, saw nothing, was nothing.
Had anyone ever asked him what death felt like, he probably would've shrugged his shoulders
Matt was dead, make no mistake about it. Nothing remained of him, no central nerve nervous system to hold his consciousness, no nerve endings left to gather information about the world around him
Julie's body had made quick work of him, extracted all the fats and nutrients, then expelled whatever remained through her own natural bodily processes.
Yet here he was. Beyond all reason and beyond all belief Matt was conscious without a body.
Somehow, someway, even without a brain he could still think and be self aware.
This was incredible! Neurological scientists would be crawling over each other, screaming, and getting into fistfights in the aisles to experience what he's experiencing right now.
This... this couldn't be the end of him.
Matt had to find a way to reach out to someone, to find out what;s going on.
14422211121111212121.title: Not the breast way to go out

14422211121111212122.content:
Matt began to come to after falling into the stomach acid. He couldn't understand how it was possible for him to survive Julie's stomach.

He couldn't shake the most peculiar feeling as his vision slowly came into focus. The incredible amount of pink around him clued him into his location. But, how how he made it to Julie's bedtime. Had she puked him up after all ?

Matt's view was suddenly engulfed by Julie's outstretched legs, and feet. When Matt tried to turn around to see Julie's face he was shocked that his vision rotated, but his body remained still.

Above him Julie casually chewed gum while playing on her phone. She didn't seem to be paying him any attention at all.

"What the hell is going on?!" Matt asked in complete confusion.

Julie sat up and looked around. Matt's world shifted again, but he didn't fall off of her belly. Instead he felt a strange sensation as the flesh of Julie's belly rolled together.

"Could have swore I heard something." Julie said as she pushed to her feet.

Matt rose up with her, but still didn't fall. He looked all around him trying to figure out what was going on. It wasn't until Julie moved in front of her full length mirror that the horrible truth became clear.

Matt couldn't believe what he was seeing. There was nothing on Julie's belly, yet he was obviously there. He tried to stretch and pull as hard as he could, which only served to cause Julie to giggle, as if she had been tickled.

"I can't believe it." Matt said in shock. "I've become Julie's belly!"

Julie stopped and stared down at her belly for several moments. "Matt?" She eventually asked also in shock.

There were several moments of silence. Matt wasn't sure how he felt about Julie knowing he was trapped as part of her body.

"Matt. I know I heard you. How did you become part of my belly ?" Julie asked, genuinely curious.

Matt hesitated but finally responded. "I don't really know. It must be a side effect of the formula."

With a devious grin Julie rubbed her belly. The circular motion of her hand caused chills to run through Matt. "Do you think it's permanent ?" Julie asked lightly tapping her fingers across Matt.

The thought of being Julie's belly for the rest of his life terrified Matt. "I don't know. I never knew the formula would effect me like this. There is just no telling how it will continue to effect either of us."
14422211121111212122.title: Matt wakes up as part of Julie’s belly

I’m not letting anyone find out that you turned yourself into a bug and got eaten by me.” She replied, removing her clothes and dressing into a sports bra and shorts. “Now then...”

"He'd actually have to show up first. I still haven't heard from him." Kellie said, concern in her voice.

Julie couldn't help but smile. "I'm sure he's around here somewhere." She pushed to her feet. "Okay so, what do you want to do ? I'm kinda hungry, or we could maybe go to the beach."

Another truck came to dump the trash, and it was right above the cup he was in. The trash fell, forcefully compressing all the trash beneath it, including the cup Matt was in! A large, heavy can landed right on the cup and crushed it flat. The milkshake oozed out a bit, and Matt was squashed completely out of existence. The harsh reality is that Julie was about to let the fly go, but because of Kellie mentioning Sean, she got sidetracked by a crush.

Matt felt the smooth surface of the couch beneath him. As he moved he realized his body felt more.... normal. Had the antidote worked? With trepidation, Matt opened his eyes and slowly looked down. To his elation, his body appeared completely human. The fact that he was still half an inch tall did nothing to suppress his hopes for returning to normal - he just needed more of the blue liquid.

That was when he noticed Julie. Now in her bathing suit, she was rummaging around in the small refrigerator Matt had used to hold his shrinking formula. Matt turned to look at her backpack on the other side of the couch. The zipper was open, partially revealing Julie's clothing and some books. His gaze fell on a familiar looking container in the corner of the pack. "Oh no!" he squeaked "The antidote!"
14422211121121212.title: Still trapped

choices: She drinks what's left of the red potion and ends up shrinking herself!
She finds Matt and tries to crush him!
14422211122.title: Something else happens

144222111221.content:
A curious Samantha licked the potion from the tips of her fingers. The taste was horrible, her expression twisting as if she sucked on a lime.

"Ugh! That's disgusting!" She exclaimed slamming the jar on the table.

"I told you not to mess with it!" Kellie scolded.

Julie groaned in frustration. "Let's just go to the pool." She said.

Samantha felt unwell, but agreed. "Great, I'm tired of looking for Matt."

Matt looked in shock, uncertain how that tiny taste of the formula would affect Samantha.

As the trio began to exit Matt turned his attention towards the antidote Kellie left unattended. Taking flight he buzzed toward it excitedly. His loud buzzing however drew Samantha's attention, who casually swatted him from the sky.

"Stupid bug." She hissed not looking back at her tiny victim.

In an uncontrolled free fall Matt landed on the cold ground as Kellie approached. On his back, wings pinned he was as his sister's flip flop clad foot fell towards him.

"Kellie!" He buzzed desperately.

With an explosive crash her foot fell so near him he was tossed away by the impact. She continued without realizing she almost crushed her brother.

He lay there for several moments after the door closed. "The antidote!" He said, buzzing back into the air, flying towards the blue liquid without interference.
144222111221.title: Samantha's curiosity

1442221112211.content:
Samantha was on her way to the pool after stopping by her house for a bathing suit. She told her friends to go on ahead of her.

After arriving at the pool she made her way into the locker room to change. She hadn't spotted Kellie or Julie, but knew there were running around somewhere.

Feeling exhausted, and ill she undressed, and pulled on her new one piece bathing suit. Letting out a sigh she rubbed her eyes before shoving her belongs into a locker.

She turned for the door, her steps sluggish. "What's wrong with me?" She muttered under her breath. Barely able to take another step Samantha's vision darkened as she fell unconscious.

As Samantha regains consciousness she feels pressure over her entire body. With no light penetrating where she was confusion washed over her. "What the hell ?" She asked, as she sat up, pushing the strange feeling material.

Crawling forward she hoped to find some way out. She felt like she was in a collapsed circus tent made of some sort of cool, squishy ropes.

Samantha felt unusual rhythmic tremors, like heaving drumming radiating through the ground. She assumed someone had brought music, and was playing it very loudly.

"Samantha?" She heard a unbelievably loud voice call out.

"She's not in here" another voice boomed.

She quickly recognized her friends voices. She felt both relieved and confused. "Guys. I'm right here. Something fell in me! Help me out."

"I wonder where she is ?" Julie asked, moving further into the room. She glances down at a random discarded bathing suit on the floor.

Samantha was getting more, and more confused if that was even possible. The tremors started again, this time louder. She continued to push her way from under the material.

"People are so gross." Kellie said, moving towards the discarded bathing suit.

"Julie, Kellie?!" She called out. Ahead she saw light breaking in. With a rush of energy she forced her way out.

The world seemed to slow down as Samantha's brain tried to understand what she was seeing. in front of her towering above her was Kellie's right foot. Five pudgy digits, moist from already being in the pool wiggled menacingly. Samantha slowly craned her head back to try to see the full height of her now gigantic friend.

"This can't be real." She whispers to herself.

Julie appeared beside her, her moist feet causing an audible smack. Samantha realized they were both looking down at the ground. Not at her, but at her bathing suit. This was her best chance at getting their attention.

"Julie! Kellie!" She called as she waved her arms. She noticed a strange feeling just as their eyes locked in on her tiny form.
1442221112211.title: Continue with the girls.

14422211122111.content: Samantha expected her two giant friends to recognized her as she got their attention, but she doesn't noticed that she's been transformed by the side effects as Kelly and Julie see her as a...
14422211122111.title: Experiencing side effects

144222111221111.content:
As she waved her arms Samantha immediately realized they didn't look human. Slender, black armor replaced flesh. A single flexible hair cover appendage in pace of her hands. Looking down at her body it was mostly human, but was mixed with patches of the same black, hair coated armor of her arms. On her back she felt a pair of wings beginning to expand.

She was trapped some place between human, and fly. "Oh, no." She said in horror.

"Gross, a bug just crawled out of it." Kellie said in disgust.

"No, I'm not a bug!" Samantha protested. "Please. It's me."

Julie leaned in closer. "It's so ugly." Obviously not recognizing her friend.

Samantha jumped up in down frantically. "Julie! It's me, Samantha." Fear swelling in her throat.

Julie, and Kellie stepped back quickly from the bug's aggressive movement. "Careful, it's angry. It might bite you." Kellie warned.

"No, no, please." Samantha cried. Her wings beginning to buzz lifting her off of the ground. Her friends retreated a few more quick steps as she rose higher into the air.

"Help me!" Samantha screamed in raw desperation as she moved closer to the giant friends' faces.

They both panicked from the ugly bug's attack. Squeals, and wildly flailing hands. Regardless of well aimed, or lucky one of their swats knocked Samantha out of the air.

She landed painfully on the ground nearly unconscious. The giantesses Kellie and Julie move in closer towards her downed form.
144222111221111.title: Fly just like Matt

1442221112211111.content:
Samantha eventually began to stir awake, not fully remembering passing out. "Ow." She moaned. Her body sore from head to toe.

A few moments after awakening she jolted to attention the memory of her friends' assault washing over her. She thought she was done for, but somehow survived.

Stranger still was trying to figure out where she was currently. Crawling around she felt thick, sticky slime all around her. The smell was so familiar to her, she just couldn't place it at first.

An attempt to fly away proved where she was had a hard ceiling. After a few minutes of tracing along the walls she figured out there were no corners. After she slipped, getting the slime in her mouth she knew exactly where she was.

"Ketchup." She said under her breath in shock.

Instead of squashing Samantha, her friends captured her. She was trapped, sealed tightly in a ketchup container from lunch.

With no light to see she knew she had to be somewhere else. A bag, or locker. Both ? The more she figured out, the more questions she had.

With nothing she could possibly do to escape, Samantha sat down. She waited for what felt like an hour, or more.

The sound of a metal locker door opening tore through the silence. "I wonder why Samantha never came." Julie's asked.

Samantha's prison shook violently as the bag it was in was snatched roughly from the locker. It was unceremoniously dropped on the bench below. "Hey!" Samantha called out. "It's me!"

The container was knocked on its side as clothes where pulled from the bag. The combination of bright overhead lighting, and the container's opaque plastic made it impossible to see whose bag she was in.

A wet bathing suit was shoved inside, and the bag resealed. In an instant it was lifted, and sling over a giantess' shoulder. Samantha would just have to wait to see who was in possession of her.
1442221112211111.title: Captured

14422211122111111.content:
Samantha remained trapped for hours before finding out she was in Julie's bag. Her friend carried her to her home, but seeming forgot her the trapped bug.

After Julie got home she carelessly toss her big onto her bed. The tiny plastic prison tumbled violently inside. Samantha was by hated ketchup. However after another hour pasted by she found herself hungry. She snacked begrudgingly hoping Julie would return soon.

Julie eventually did return to her bag, but to Samantha's disappointment it was only to retrieve her bathing suit.

What Samantha didn't know, was it was Kellie who decided to keep the bug. She captured her in the cup. She had hurriedly dropped the cup into what she thought was her bag. Instead it was Julie's identical version.

With no reason to notice the little cup of ketchup and Samantha, Julie tossed the bag in her closet. Leaving her best friend trapped.

A few days past, and Samantha still hated ketchup, but was thankful for it. It had sustained her, but she knew it wouldn't last forever.

About two weeks later Samantha was nearly out of ketchup. She didn't know how long her body would last after it ran out, but she didn't want to find out.

One day the closet opened, Julie didn't reach for the bag, but accidentally knocked it over. An old tiny ketchup cup rolls out between her feet.
14422211122111111.title: Julie's bag

144222111221111111.content:
Julie looked down at the plastic container between her feet. After a moment she remembers the bug from the pool. "Oh God!" She squealed before stomping the container flat in a panic.

Samantha's prison was suddenly crushed. she was sore but alive thanks to being in the middle.

Julie nudge the container with her toe separating the lid. Samantha's body tumbled out in tact. "Gross!" Julie said in disgust.

Somehow Samantha managed to fly. She took off as quickly as she could, but was swatted out of the sky.

Landing in the hallway Samantha tried to run away. Her path blocked by Julie's Mom. Samantha knew she was spotted.

"Wait. Stop." She screamed at the middle aged woman closed the distance between them. She brought her sandal clad foot down with enough force to liquify Samantha's body.
144222111221111111.title: She noticed

144222111221111112.content:
Julie didn't notice the tiny cup rolling out of the bag, or when she turned and kicked it with her sneaker clad foot.

Samantha was spun wildly as the cup rolled across the floor. It came to a stop, falling over lid down. Dizzy beyond belief Samantha felt tremors all around as Julie moves through out her room.

Through the opaque plastic she could only make out Julie's silhouette. "Julie! Please help me!" She begged pounding on the plastic wall.

The cup had come to a stop out of sight, under Julie's desk. Samantha continued to pound on the walls for attention.

An hour past and Samantha saw the silhouette of Julie's blue sneakers moving towards her. The tremors grew increasingly strong as Julie Wales towards her desk.

She sat down in her comfy pink chair, stretching her legs out. Her foot just barely missing the container. Samantha screamed as it drew back and came to rest right beside her prison.

Julie say at her computer with barely a twitch for nearly twenty minutes. She then put in ear buds to listen to music. It wasn't long before her foot began to tap.

Each rise and fall shook Samantha's prison. "Stop! Stop! Stop!" She screamed.

Julie adjusted in her seat and began tap once more. Now the rubber sole of her shoe slammed down on the container.

It's plastic walls bend, and spring bag with every tap. She didn't really seem to notice the difference under her foot.

Samantha cowers in the center of the lid, screaming constantly. The song ends, and Julie's foot rests on top of the prison.

As Julie adjusts again the weight of her foot begins to flatten the tiny cup. "Not like this!" Samantha cries.

As soon as it began it ended. Julie lifts her foot off of the cup. A moment later the shoes tumble off of her feet. She stretches socked clad toes, before returning to her position.

Without her shoes she is fully aware of the plastic cup. Her long toes arch over it blocking most of Samantha's light. She toys with it absentmindedly as she scrolls through Twitter.

She pinches it, before lifting it into the air. Samantha noticed part of the lid is free. If she could time it right she might be able to escape.

Julie holds the cup tightly in her toes as it is brought into the air. Samantha rushes for the gap. She dives out just as the cup falls again.
144222111221111112.title: Unaware

1442221112211111121.content:
Her wings are useless after so long being confined, and coated in ketchup. she is unable to stop herself from landing in Julie's shoe.

The sweat soaked insole provided a decent cushion to land on. But the smell was nearly enough to make Samantha pass out.

Samantha looks up through the opening to see only Julie's legs rising above her. Despite the everything that happened so far, Julie was her friend. She would help her, if she could just get her attention.

The bug girl moved to the heel cup to begin her climb out of the shoe. With her insect legs it only took a few moments to reach the top.

She was hesitant to simple jump onto the ground. Her chances of survival were low enough. Samantha hoped to maybe climb Julie's leg like she had the shoe.

Samantha jumped onto Julie's socked foot. It wasn't hard for her, but the smell was barely better than the shoe. "Jesus." Samantha groaned.

She had barely began to climb when Julie stood. Samantha was for to cling to the sock as Julie pushed her chair away from the desk.

Julie leaned forward and retrieved the plastic container. she looked at it, but didn't recognize it. She tossed it into her trash can before standing.

Samantha had to cling tightly to the sock as Julie walked downstairs to the kitchen. Her movements made it too dangerous to move.

Julie grabbed a bowl and filled it with cereal. She grabbed the bottle of milk before heading to the living room. After setting her bowl down she flopped back without warning.

Samantha was tossed into the air from her foot slinging outward. Tumbling uncontrollably Samantha screamed as she landed in a bowl of cocoa pebbles.

Julie sat forward and poured cold milk in the bowl. Samantha was swept away in the current. Before she could even surface a spoon shot down mixing the milk and cereal further.
1442221112211111121.title: She lands in Julie's shoe.

14422211122111111211.content:
Samantha struggles to maneuver in the cereal fill milk. Her heart races at the sounds of spoonful being repeatedly lifted out, and ate.

Julie barely looks down at her bowl of cereal while she mindlessly shoves the chocolatey goodness into her mouth.

Without warning Samantha is on the spoon as it raises put of the bowl. She is spilled off with more overflowing cocoa pebbles.

A near miss, but too close. At least now she's on top. She tries to crawl towards the edge only for the spoon to strike again.

Somehow she manages to get off the spoon every time, but the bowl is getting more empty. Her time is running out.

She hears the spoon clank on the table as it is set down. Relief sweeps over her. Maybe Julie is full. The bowl is raised into the air. The ceral all shifts to one side.

Samantha screams again. "Julie! Please, God no!" Her cries for help go unanswered as Julie gulps down waves of milk and cereal.

The bowl is lowered, but only for a moment. again Julie raises the bowl to her lips. Samantha slams into them, but she struggles to stay free. Julie's mouth opens wider taking her in.

"Stop!" Samantha cries as cereal crunches into paste around her. She tries to crawl back out but the tongue lifts and slams her into teeth. Julie's crushes her instantly.

Julie drains the rest of the milk in several powerful gulps. Setting the bowl down she kicks back, and continues to watch TV.
14422211122111111211.title: Eaten

1442221112211111122.content:
Samantha landed with a tiny plop on the carpet below. Julie's continued play caused the smell of her sweaty socks to waft over Samantha. "Eww, gross Julie." Samantha groaned.

Deciding that being this close to to Julie's feet wasn't a good idea Samantha moved to the leg of the desk. Cowering in relative safety, she tried to figure out how best to get help.

Julie was going to be of no help, she would squash her at the first chance. Samantha's best hope was getting back to Kellie's. Her brother Matt might be her best help.

Someone knocked at Julie's door. She didn't hear it with her ear buds still in. After another unanswered knock the door pushed open.

Your friend Amanda stepped inside the room, and closed the door behind her. she rolled her eyes seeing Julie so oblivious.

She crept up behind Julie slowly, needlessly tiptoeing with her birkenstock clad feet. "Rawr!" She screamed pushing Julie.

Julie yelped loudly in shock. She swung around quickly, her feet sailing inches from Samantha. "Oh my God! Don't do that!" She growled standing to push the still laughing Amanda.

Amanda flopped back onto the bed. "Okay, so I came to see if you wanted to go to Kellie's." She said, still amused by her prank.

Samantha perked up instantly. She knew this could be her best shot to find Matt, and figure out what happened to her.

"Sounds great." Julie replied. "I just have to grab my flip flops."

While Julie removed and toss her sweaty socks aside Samantha prepared to make her move. She watched Julie and Amanda closely, waiting for the perfect moment.

As the two giantesses turned to leave Samantha bolted out from her hiding place with all of her energy.
1442221112211111122.title: On the ground.

choices: Find a way into the basement
14422211122111111222.content:
Samantha is elated as she takes flight. Her wings seeming to work. However it was short lived, a massive cramp in her back halted her wings instantly.

Barely able to control her fall Samantha just managed to catch herself on Amanda's foot. She hit the giantess' instep with a thud. Thankfully one that went unnoticed.

Samantha held onto the faint hairs on Amanda's foot. She wanted to move to the Birkenstocks' straps, but couldn't risk Amanda feeling the movements.

For the entire fifteen minute walk to Kellie's Samantha held tightly. She was determined to be rescued. She refused to be a bug forever.

Upon entering Kellie's home Samantha groaned seeing the basement door closed. She had to get to Matt, and that was where he was most likely to be.

Distracted Samantha wasn't ready for Amanda kicking off her Birkenstocks. Samantha tumbled forward, slamming into the leather strap. She fell onto the insole below.

Amanda used her right foot to shove the Birkenstocks against the wall. The rough movement sent Samantha over the edge, and into the tiled entryway floor.

Julie's flip flops landed right on either side of the tiny bug girl. Before she could even react Julie pushed them out of the walk way. She could only cower, and scream as the rubber soles of the flip flops flew past her like speeding trains.

Her heart racing faster than should be possible Samantha stood in shock for a few moments. Thankfully her friends moved on to Kellie's bedroom.

Samantha eventually regained her composure. looking at the basement door, then the stairs Samantha had to decide where to look for Matt first.
14422211122111111222.title: Grabs a ride.

choices: A pair of underwear fall on top of Samantha
The tiny fly girl is safe for now.
144222111221111112222.content:
Samantha moved quickly and with purpose. She realized that she must have been turned into a fly girl by that strange liquid in Matt's lab. She remembered the other liquid, and hoped it was an antidote.

It was easy enough to slip through the slight open basement door. Using her tiny size to her advantage she quickly bound down the stairs. As she hopped from tread to tread she heard someone moving in the lab. "I hope Matt is here! He'll help me!" She said excitedly to herself.

As Samantha reached the basement floor she was shocked to see Matt, and Kellie's oldest sibling Shawn. Samantha had a bit of a crush on the tall, well built jock. He never seemed to notice her though. And that was before she was bug sized.

"Oh crap!" She said staring up in awe at the now very gigantic Shawn.

Holding a bundle of laundry in his massive arms Shawn stumbled towards the base of the stairs. His rough bare feet smacking the concrete floor ominously.

Samantha had no time to move as the giant moved quickly towards her. In an instant he was above her. His face blocked from view by the laundry. A long calloused sole rising into the air.
144222111221111112222.title: Find a way into the basement

1442221112211111122222.content:
Samantha was forced to leap into the air to avoid being crushed under Shawn's monstrous foot. Her last second action was successful, but with an unfortunate consequence. Instead of landing safely on the ground, she was swept onto Shawn's long toes.

The giant didn't notice a new passenger as he continued up the basement stairs. Samantha held tightly to the long hairs on Shawn's big toe. She was desperately over riding on people's feet. She had every intention of bailing as soon as Shawn came to a stop.

Shawn entered his bedroom and haphazardly tossed the laundry onto a chair. Making a beeline for his bed the giant turned and flopped backwards. His legs kicked up into the air sending Samantha flying.

With unresponsive wings Samantha was powerless as she flew.....
1442221112211111122222.title: Samantha climbs onto Shawn's foot.

14422211122111112.content:
Kellie forgot about the captured bug for a few days. She wasn't really into bugs, but she had never seen one like it. Her Dad had studied entomology when he was in college. She thought he might be interested.

Samantha had been reduced to eating the ketchup to survive. She hadn't had any interaction with Kellie since she took her bathing suit out a few days ago.

After a random statement from her Dad at breakfast Kellie remembered the bug. She rummaged through her bag, and pulled the container out.

Kellie popped the top off to make sure it was still alive. Samantha called up to her friend fruitlessly. "Okay, good. Not dead." Kellie said relieved.

She carried the cup in her pocket until her Dad finished eating. "Dad, I have something I want you to see." She told him as he stood from the table.

The two stood in his office desk. A bright light fixed on the container. Samantha's eyes slowly adjusted to see the lumbering giants staring down at her.

"A ketchup cup, darling?" Kellie's Dad asked jokingly.

"It's what I had." She shrugged. "So, what it is ?"

Samantha began to wave her arms and cry out as Kellie's Dad lowered a magnifying glass towards her. "It's me, Samantha!"

He stared for several moments, before poking at Samantha with his pen. "I'm not really sure, maybe some kind of fly." He said.

Samantha's heart sank. He was looking at her with a magnifying glass yet didn't recognize her.

Kellie grabbed the magnifying glass from her dad. "Kellie!" Samantha pleaded.

There was no look of recognition in Kellie's eyes. "I don't know, but it sure is ugly, and violent. It attacked me and Julie."

"Well, what do you want to do with it ?" Kellie's Dad asked.

"You don't want it ?" She asked.

"I don't really have the setup for insects anymore." He said looking around his cluttered office. "Let it go, or squish it. it's up to you."
14422211122111112.title: Kellie's bag

144222111221111121.content:
"I guess it's harmless enough." Kellie said. "I'll just toss it out the window."

Samantha was in full panic. "Kellie! It's me. You have to help me!"

Kellie of course didn't pay any attention to the random buzzing of the strange fly. She snapped the lid back on the ketchup cup sealing Samantha inside again.

She carried the cup up to her bedroom, where she immediately moved to open her window. As the popped the lid back off of the cup she simultaneously tossed Samantha out.

Samantha screamed as she fly through the air. Her wings buzzed to life intermittently ensuring she wouldn't simply crash to the ground.

She was a few inches off the ground when her wings seized up for the last time. The tiny fly girl tumbled into the tall green grass forest.

Pushing to her feet Samantha wanted to cry. Her best friend just tossed her out of a window so unceremoniously. She was now standing, surrounded by tree sized blades of grass.

Unable to see very far in any direction Samantha decided to walk towards where she though Kellie's house was.

For nearly twenty minutes she walked without leaving the grass forest. Samantha didn't plan on giving up. She kept trudging forward until she felt the ground begin to tremble.

Samantha was suddenly staring at...
144222111221111121.title: Released

1442221112211111212.content:
Samantha was knocked back by a descending foot. As the dust settled the tiny fly girl was staring at an enormous, dirty bare foot. It was long, rough, with unkempt nails paint green.

It was strange to think but Samantha recognized the giantess based solely on their foot. Craning her neck up to see the girl's silhouette in the sun Samantha knew this was Karolina.

Karolina was best described as a 20 year old who was born in the wrong decade. Everything about her was very hippie, flower child. Samantha and her friends would always avoid the strange girl.

Another series of quick tremors reminded Samantha that Karolina was never alone. Turning around Samantha saw the outline of Gwen towering above her.

Gwen was very similar to Karolina, and the pair were rarely seen apart. As she knelt down Samantha could see the giantess' ever present camcorder. The device was clutched steadily in her hand as she scanned the ground with it.

"Do you see anything yet ?" Karolina asked, her massive barefoot shifting in the grass.

Samantha backpedaled away from the gargantuan digits wiggled just in front of her.

"Yeah, I see a really weird one right in front of your toes." Gwen said, zooming her camera in on Samantha.

The barefoot giantess bent down to see the strange insect for herself. Samantha was frozen in fear as she realized the giantesses were focusing their attention on her vulnerable form.

"Oh, hi there little guy." Karolina cooed softly.

Samantha's body was trembling uncontrollably. She wanted to run, but was frozen under the gaze of Karolina's piercing green eyes. She couldn't take her eyes off of the giantess as she swept her shoulder length red hair behind her right ear.

"I wonder what it's like to be so tiny." Karolina mused.

She reached down with her index finger outstretched. Samantha finally found the ability to move again. She scurried backward but was overtaken by the car sized tip of Karolina's finger.

Without adding pressure the giantess was easily able to hold the tiny fly girl immobile. Meanwhile Gwen adjusted to get a good shot of the insect's struggles.

"I can feel your teeny-tiny legs tickling my finger buggy." Karolina said with an amused tone.

The giantess adjusted her finger behind Samantha as her thumb slid into place. Gently pinching the bug Karolina brought Samantha into the air. She then...
1442221112211111212.title: A barefoot

14422211122111112121.content:
Samantha was only raised in the air a few inches. Karolina dropped the tiny fly girl into her awaiting right foot.

She landed on top of Karolina's monstrous bug toe, just behind the nail. The skin was dry, and dirty, with lightly colored hair at the knuckle.

Before Samantha could even Karolina playfully wiggled her toes. The minuscule fly girl was bounced across the giantess' long digit.

With a vice like grip Samantha grasped onto the hairs on the second toe's knuckle. She held on tightly as Karolina wiggled her toes more aggressively to dislodge her little play thing.

"That's not playing fair buggy." Karolina pouted.

Karolina raised her foot upwards, leaving her heel on the ground. She wiggled her toes in the air before slamming her foot back down.

The impact shook Samantha to the core. Her grip held, but barely. Unfortunately Karolina was already lifting her foot again.

When the foot hit the ground again Samantha was toss between the second and big toe. Karolina spread her toes wide sending the fly girl into the ground below.

Samantha screamed as the toes fell down around her. They arched over like fallen buildings. "Stop!" She cried out, but was unheard.

Gwen held the camera at ground level. She zoomed in on the tiny bug as Karolina playfully tapped her toes.

The giantess shifted her foot off of Samantha. Looking down she wore a satisfied grin. She raised her foot all the way off the ground.

Samantha cowered as the rough, calloused ball of Karolina's foot repositioned over her. It lowered down slowly, but raised up again. She heard menacing giggles from above as the giantess toyed with her.

The foot slammed down next to her without warning. The impact sent dust into the air around the fly girl.

Before the dust could clear Samantha saw Karolina's toes above her again. The big toe was held above her as Gwen adjusted for a new angle.

Resting her foot on the ground Karolina smiled as she held her toes over the bug. When Gwen was in position she quickly dropped her toes.

Samantha barely had time to brace as the gigantic pad of the big toe slammed down. The impact pressed the rough flesh into Samantha. her body creaked in protest.

Almost as fast as it fell the toe lifted. Samantha was alive, but could no longer move. She could only stare upward as Karolina brought the toe down again for a second quick tap.

After three more taps Samantha was nearly crushed. Still alive, but suffering horribly Samantha watched as the foot raised into the air.

Karolina repositioned her foot over the insect. With a powerful stomp she felt the bug crush under the ball of her foot.

She twisted it back and forth before raising it back into the air. Grabbing her ankle she held her sole skyward. Gwen zoomed in on the tiny insect carcass splattered across the dirty flesh.

"This one was very fun." Karolina said with a smile. "Let's find another one."
14422211122111112121.title: Dropped onto hippie toes

144222111221111122.content:
"It was pretty aggressive." Kellie said matter-of-factly. She tilted her head to the side. "It could be carrying some kind of foreign flu"

Samantha was trying to get her wings to work. Days out of use, and coated in ketchup left them nearly useless.

"Like I said, it's up to you darling. I'm going to get ready for work." Kellie's dad moves to leave the room.

"Thanks Dad." Kellie said, bending down at the desk.

"Kellie, please, it's me!" Samantha screamed, all the time trying to get her wings to function.

Kellie reached out, taking the cup in her hand. She tuned it over sending the tiny bug out onto the desk. Without a word she brought the flip flop she took off into the air.

"No!" Samantha screamed before being cut off as the flip flop slammed down. Her tiny body smashed instantly.
144222111221111122.title: Squish.

1442221112211112.content:
Samantha groaned in pain from her crash landing. Her body ached, and her wings stunned. She tried to sit up as Kellie, and Julie approached.

"Eww, step on it." Kellie said, nudging Julie forward.

Julie resisted. "No way, I'm not wearing shoes. You do it"

Samantha couldn't believe her friends were arguing over who would squash her. "Stop." She coughed out. "I'm your friend."

Making it to her feet Samantha tried to make her way under the bench. Her wings still not responding to her efforts. unfortunately her attempted escape didn't go unnoticed.

"It's getting away!" Julie squealed.

Quick to action Kellie slammed her barefoot down blocking the bug's path. "Oh no you don't." She said proudly.

"Well, why don't you just step on it then." Julie said in a mocking tone.

Kellie sneered, then turned her chin up. "Fine! I will."

Samantha stumbled backwards as her friend's sole hovered above her. The flesh still moist, and pruned from the water.

"No, please, please don't!" Samantha sobbed, literally down on her knees.

Kellie's bravado wavering, her foot held in the air for several moments. She said she would do it. Not wanting to look like a chicken she touched her toes to the floor behind the bug.

"Are you scared?" Julie said with a grin, her arms crossed.

Kellie looked at Julie with annoyance. Taking a deep breath she slapped her foot down. Nearly as quickly she hopped back away from the insect.

Samantha screamed as the plump, soft ball of Kellie's foot shot down. The impact pressed her into the tile for only a fraction of a second. The hard chitinous armor covering most of her body prevented her from being turned into paste.

Julie laughed wildly at her friend's 'bravery'. "Oh, you're so tough." She said flexing her arms.

Kellie scowled at Julie. "I did it didn't I. You where too scared to." A smug smile stretched across her lips.

Julie looked down at the still twitching bug. "Uh-huh. Good job." She said, clapping her hands with a mocking rhythm.

Seeing the bug still alive drained the smugness from Kellie. She rolled her eyes. "Let's just see you do better then." Her hand gesturing towards Samantha.

Her body cracked, but not broken Samantha tried to ignore the pain to stand. Somehow she hot her legs under her. Wobbling, but not falling Samantha turned towards the bench for safety. she knew her friends wouldn't recognize her now.

Julie narrowed her eyes staring down at the bug as it attempted to escape. She closed the distance between her and the bug in only a few steps. Towering above the injured insect she brought her right foot up above. With a glance, and a grin to Kellie she stomped down with force. She felt the bug crunch under the ball of her foot. With a firm twist she drug her foot backwards leaving the bug's splattered remains behind.

"And that's how you squash a bug." She said wearing her own smug grin.

"Alright, alright, you win." Kellie said rolling her eyes. "No let's get out of here, and go find Samantha."

"I hope nothing bad happened to her" Kellie said wiping the rest of the bug off her foot with her towel.
1442221112211112.title: Attack continued.

144222111221112.content:
"Wow!" Exclaimed Julie. "It's so pretty."

Kellie looked down with a warm smile. "I know. I wonder how it got in here though."

Samantha was confused by her friends' reaction. "Guys! It's me! Help!" Her body felt weird, she realized she wasn't standing on two legs, but six long skinny ones.

Julie knelt down slowly. "Careful, you'll scare it." Kellie said with a soft, but warning tone.

"It's fine." Julie said her hand reaching out slowly. "It seems hurt, or confused for some reason"

Samantha tried to deal with the sight of her friend's giant hand coming towards her, and the realization that she had large wings coming out of her back.

Julie's index finger appeared in front of her stopping the runaway thoughts in her head. "Come on, it's okay." Julie said softly.

It felt strange to walk on six legs, but she used them all to perch upon the massive finger tip. She clung tightly as Julie stood.

"What should we do with it ?" Julie asked Kellie, who looked on quietly admiring the fairy like insect.

Samantha chimed in. "Take me back to Matt's lab!" Of course her voice wasn't recognizable to the giantesses.

"I guess we could release it outside, or maybe take it with us." Julie said, not sure what to do.

The girls pondered their options quietly for a few moments before deciding.
144222111221112.title: Rare beautiful butterfly

1442221112212.content:
Thankful that he was now alone in his lab Matt flew quickly to the jar with the antidote. He could feel the excitement as he slowly lowered onto the jar. He crawled down the smooth wall, and quickly began taking in as much of the antidote as the little fly body could.

Not wanting to start to regrow inside the glass jar Matt flew out and landed on the table near by. There he waited with increasing anticipation for the antidote to take affect.

Several long moments passes. Then even longer minutes. Anticipation turned to frustration.

"Maybe I need more." Matt theorized.

He swiftly returned to the jar for another intake. Repeating the process he returned to the table to wait.

When nearly ten minutes past with the same lack of results Matt began to panic. "What if it doesn't work ?"

He knew there was always a possibility of failure. There always is with experimental. "No! This will work!" He proclaims confidently before repeating the process again.

Time and time again he drank the antidote, and waited for it to work. After a dozen attempts Matt simple let himself float in the blue liquid.

Growing more depressed with the lack of growth Matt began to fear this form was a permanent one. "I'm trapped as a fly forever." He said completely heartbroken.

In his oblivious state Matt hadn't noticed someone entering the lab until a shadow cast over the jar.
1442221112212.title: Stay with Matt.

14422211122121.content:
"This place is always such a mess." Matt heard heard his Mom groaning.

She appeared over the jar a moment later. Matt stared up in awe at the incredible perspective. "She's so huge." He said.

Noticing the tiny buzzing she looks down at the jar. She sighs seeing a fly stuck in whatever the blue liquid was. "That's disgusting." She says.

"Mom! It's me! Don't mess with the jar!" Matt tried to get her to leave, but it wasn't working.

Her massive hand reached out lifting the antidote into the air. "Stop!" Matt screamed, trying to fly away. He had soaked his wings making them useless.

His Mom carried the jar towards the sink. "No! Don't pour it out!" Matt begged endlessly.

She didn't hesitate to dump the contents, fly and all out. Matt landed in the sink as the liquid poured down the drain. Spared from the drain he stared up at his Giantess Mom in horror.

She reached down towards him, her thumb outstretched. She mercilessly crushed the fly before washing her hands off in the sink.
14422211122121.title: Matt's Mom

14422211122122.content:
"Matt? You down here ?" Andy asked seeing the antidote on the table.

Matt stared up at his giant friend. "Andy! It's me!" He called out.

Andy lifted the jar and saw a tiny fly floating inside. "You shouldn't be in there." He said seemingly scolding the fly.

Matt protested but his body was removed by surprisingly gentle fingers. Andy dropped the fly on the table before returning the antidote to the refrigerator.

Matt tried to shake the liquid off of his wings so he could fly. Before he could Andy returned above him.

"I wonder if the antidote affect your little guy." Andy pondered outloud.

Unfortunately Matt knew it hadn't thus far. "Andy, it's me Matt. You have to put me back. I need more." He tried to explain, but it wasn't working.

Andy stared at the little fly for a long while. Seemingly to see it anything happened. Of course nothing did.

"Hmm, I guess it had no affect." He said standing back up straight. "What to do with you then ?"
14422211122122.title: Andy

144222111221221.content:
Matt reacted near instantly to dodge Andy's first attempt to swat him. He maneuvered around several more attempts. Matt quickly tried to put distance between himself and his friend.

He was well out of Andy's reach when his entire body was doused in foul, burning liquid. His wings seized up as his body convulsed in mid air. As he fell he saw Andy approaching, bug spray in hand.

With no effort Andy moved above the downed fly. "Andy, wait!" Matt begged, his body burning all over.

Matt tried to crawl away as Andy's flip flop clad foot raised above him. With no hesitation Andy stomped down smashing the fly.

"I wonder where Matt got off to." Andy said walking up the stairs, leaving tiny bits of his best friend behind with each step.
144222111221221.title: Squish

144222111221222.content:
After a moment Andy grabs a small plastic cup. "Matt will probably be interested in you little guy." Andy says preparing to capture you.

"Wait! I am Matt! Andy stop!" The fly boy screams as he takes flight.

Desperate to avoid capture Matt's tiny wings buzz frantically. "Oh no you don't little guy." Andy says. His right hand knocks Matt out of the air.

Before Matt could react the plastic cup fell on top if him. Andy slid the cup off the edge of the table, secured the lid. "Gotcha!" He proclaimed triumphantly.

Matt was reeling as Andy tunes the cup right side up. "Matt's going to be glad I caught you." Andy said, voice full of pride.

"Andy! I am Matt!" The tiny fly boy buzzed angrily. "Let me out of here!"

Turning to leaving Andy shoved the cup into his pocket. Matt was left in near complete darkness as his friend bounded back up the stares. Every step jostled Matt inside the cup.

Matt was beginning to feel I'll as Andy sat down in his car to drive home. During the relatively short drive the tiny fly boy puked his guts up several times.

He was barely aware of anything until after Andy dumped him over into a larger plastic container. Matt recognized it as the one Andy used for his pet salamander. Matt was thankful that he was now the only inhabitant.

Matt began to fade in and out of consciousness. At some time during one of his black outs Andy added a small bowl of sugar water to the container.

Matt drank from the cup hoping that hunger was the reason for his sickness. For a few moments he did in fact feel better. However without warning Matt passed out on the floor of the container.

Eventual Matt begins to stir. As he regains consciousness he sees that he is....
144222111221222.title: Keep

1442221112212221.content:
Matt comes to in the middle of the night. He can hear Andy snoring from his bed. Groaning he pushes himself to his feet. He takes a step forward when he realized something had changed.

"Oh my God!" He screams as he looks down at human hands. "I'm changing back!"

Matt was now mostly human. Some parts of the fly remained, wings, and some hard black flesh. Matt was most excited to have a human voice again.

"Andy! Wake up!" He screamed, without buzzing.

The giant obviously didn't hear him, but that didn't surprise Matt. All he heard for too long when he spoke was buzzing insect sounds. Despite still being roughly half an inch tall Matt felt confident that he could return to full size.

With his new combination of fly wings, and human hands Matt hoped to escape the plastic container. He flew to the ceiling above, and tried to force open one of the small lids. He was still too small for it to work.

Landing back near the sugar water Matt drank a few more handfuls while he thought of his next move.

Feeling pain in his stomach mid sip Matt stumbled backwards as his body began to change again.

He felt his wings shrink, and fade away from his back. The remaining hard black flesh shifted back into human skin. When the changes finally stopped Matt was fully human again. Only now he was nearly two inches tall.

Matt barely had time to celebrate the growth when Andy's alarm shrieks loudly. Andy mumbles incoherently as he slams his hand down to silence the noise.

Running to the edge of the container Matt pounds on the plastic walls. "Andy wake up! Help me!" He screams.

Andy sluggishly crawls out of bed. He shuffles half awake towards the door. Matt continues to try for his friend's attention.
1442221112212221.title: Turning back human

14422211122122211.content:
Movement catches Andy's eye as he shuffles to his door. Glancing over he saw something strange in the plastic container. "What the?" He asks moving for a closer look.

"Yes! Andy! It's me! Matt screamed excitedly as his enormous friend leaned in closer.

Andy's eyes went wide in shock. "Matt ?!" He asked. "Is that really you ?"

"It's really me!" He screams. "I was the fly"

Andy gently lifts the container from the shelf. Carrying it slowly he sets it down on his desk. Reaching inside slowly he holds his hand out for Matt to climb on. Andy watches in amazement as his best friend stands in the palm of his hand.

Raising his hand into the air Andy speaks softly. "I'm sorry, did you say you were the fly ?"

Matt nods. "I drank the formula. There were some side effects."

Andy raises his eyebrows and smirks. "Yeah, side affects. You were stupid to test it alone. You could have been squished." He said scolding his tiny friend.

Hanging his head Matt knew Andy was right. "I know, I'm sorry. At least the antidote seems to work. Well, sort of."

"Little slow" Andy points out. "Maybe if I left you in the jar you'd be big by now."

Matt shrugged. "It's fine. It's probably for the best you found me." He said doubting the basement would have remained uninhabited long enough for the antidote to work. "But, now we have to get back to the lab to get more of the antidote. I'm over being so tiny."

Andy laughed as he looked down at his shrunken friend. He thought about what the best move was next.
14422211122122211.title: Andy sees Matt

144222111221222111.content:
"Okay, I'm going to put you on my desk while I get ready. I'll be right back, then we'll get you back to full size." Andy said lowering Matt down slowly.

Matt paces back and forth for what seemed like an eternity. He was so excited to return to full size his entire body was trembling. He practically jumped for joy when Andy returned.

"Okay little dude." Andy said moving to grab his best friend. "Let's get you back full size."

Andy gently lowered Matt into his shirt pocket. It was a little difficult to hold on as Andy walk, but was likely the safest place for the shrunken teen.

Matt peaked out at his giantess mom as Andy gave a bogus reason to get into the basement. "I'm setting up an experiment while Matt is out getting supplies." Andy said convincingly enough.

"Okay, tell Matt to call me when he can. I haven't been able to reach him." His Mom said.

"I'll make sure he calls you. I promise." Andy said with a smile as he opened the basement door.

After locking the door Andy hurried downstairs. Matt was practically ready to jump out of his friend's pocket as the antidote was pulled from the refrigerator.

Andy set Matt on the table while he poured some of the antidote into a small plastic cup. Matt was literally salivating as he reached for the cup. Without hesitation he chugged down the bucket sized cup of antidote.

About twenty slow, painful minutes past before Matt shot up to six inches tall. "Yes!" He screamed with pure joy.

Andy poured another cup for him to down. A few hours of incremental growth began. Eight inches, then twelve. Around the twelve inch mark Andy brought him a cloth to cover himself with. Matt was soon nearly two feet tall, and able to drink from the jar on his own.

Only wanting to drink enough to return to full height Matt only took in about a quarter cup at a time. By now he was able to wear his own lab coat, although it was a bit baggy still. After taking one final sip Matt watched with glee as he grew the final few inches.

Matt stared at himself in a full length mirror for several long moments. He was beyond ecstatic to no longer be a fly.

"I think you might actually be an inch taller." Andy pointed out with a grin.

Matt shrugged. "I deserve an extra inch after what I went through."

"I'm glad you're back buddy, but never do anything this stupid ever again!" Andy said with a huge grin.

Matt lowered his head. "Yeah, I know. Thank you for saving me."

"Of course." Andy said. "Now, call your Mom. She's worried sick."
144222111221222111.title: Take Matt to the antidote.

14422211122122212.content:
Andy walks out of the room without a glance towards the plastic container. Matt groans in frustration. The antidote was working, he just needed more of it, and he needed Andy's help to get it.

Unfortunately Andy was in too much of a rush to notice his shrunken friend. He returned to the bedroom for only the amount of time it took him.to get dressed.

Matt slumped down in his plastic prison as the bedroom door clicked shut. "Great. Now I'm going to be stuck in here at least until Andy gets home." Matt said with a sigh.

For the next few hours Matt passed the time by nervously pacing, or napping under the fake green plant in the corner.

The sudden sound of the doorknob turning drew his undivided attention. Matt bounded over to the side of the container. He peered out with great interest to see who was opening the door. He was shocked to see Andy's.....
14422211122122212.title: Andy doesn't notice Matt

144222111221222123.content:
Matt watched as Andy's girlfriend Beth strolled through the door. She was the kind of girl who was always effortlessly beautiful. Matt hated to say it, but he felt like she was way out of Andy's league. To this day he still wondered just how he landed someone so beautiful.

The instinct to hide bubbled up inside Matt, but there was no where for him to seek cover. Instead he decided to try for Beth's attention. she was always nice to him, he didn't seen any reason she wouldn't help him out.

"Hey! Beth! Over here!" He called out as he banged on the plastic.

Unlike Andy, Beth wasn't mostly asleep. She turned to investigate the tiny noise. Her crystal blue eyes widening as she spotted the tiny Matt. "Oh my God." She mouthed in shock.

"Please help me!" Matt cried out, unsure if she could understand him through the plastic.

Beth looked confused for a few moments before groaning. "Andy told me what you guys were working on." She said. "I just can't believe he tested the formula out on you." Her lips twist into a half smirk.

"What?!" Matt shouted, equally annoyed by her misunderstanding, and that Andy blabbed to her.

"You looked shocked little guy. Andy and I don't have any secrets." She said playfully tapping the side of the container. "Although, he didn't mention shrinking you. Maybe he wanted it to be a surprise."

Matt couldn't believe what he was hearing. Beth actually believed Andy shrank him, and trapped him in this container. "Andy didn't shrink me! This is all a misunderstanding!" Matt screamed desperately.

Beth pursed her lips together as she narrowed her eyes. "Uh-huh, sure tiny. Then why are you stuck in this terrarium? " she asked not believing Matt's pleas.

Matt sighed, and rubbed his temples. "I tested the formula on myself, it turned me into a fly. Andy caught me and brought me here unaware that it was me!" He yelled up, realizing how insane it sounded as he spoke.

Beth just rolled her eyes, and groaned. "Do I look stupid to you ?" She asked leaning close to the container. "Andy definitely would have a good reason for shrinking you. Knowing how selfish you can be, he probably got fed up with you treating him like a lucky." She said accusing.

Matt was very quickly growing anxious. He took a step back away from the plastic wall. "Then just leave me alone, until Andy gets home. He'll prove I'm right." He said, knowing that his friend would clear this up, and help him.

Beth glared down at Matt. "And risk him kowtowing to you like always. No, I'm taking you with me." She said pulling the lid off the container.

Matt tried to run but Beth's manicured fingers grasped him effortlessly. For a while he was feeling large compared to his former size. Now he felt small, and powerless in Beth's enormous hand.

"This punishment starts now tiny." She said dangling Matt by the ankle.

Sitting down on the edge of Andy's bed Beth used her free hand to pull off her fur lined moccasin. Matt could barely manage a scream before Beth deposited him inside. The moist, hot air was instant gagging. A not so gentle shake sent Matt harshly into the toe box of the moccasin.

"Enjoy the plush accommodations tiny." Beth mocked before her meaty toes appeared inside the opening.

As the foot slid forward Matt did the only thing he could, he laid down flat as her toes crawled over him. His entire body was wedged tightly under Beth's toes as the moccasin was pulled over her heel. Matt writhed as he attempted to reposition himself as best as possible.

Beth callously dropped her foot to the floor and stood. Her toes wiggled mercilessly on top of Matt. Immediately she began to walk, the impacts sharing Matt to the core.

With a tiny prisoner under toe Beth grabbed what she came to Andy's for and left. She took great pleasure from each step as she headed....


**Image for Beth** https://www.deviantart.com/litfeet/art/M...
144222111221222123.title: Girlfriend

1442221112212221232.content:
Evey step Beth took pressed Matt into the insole of the moccasin. The tiny teen was at least thankful that the lining was plush, and forgiving. unfortunately the plush faux-fur also held onto the odor of old sweat extremely well.

Within a few minutes Beth was in her car, her right foot keeping steady pressure on Matt. From above Matt heard Beth's phone ring. Only able to hear bits and pieces of half the conversation Matt wasn't really paying attention. Until he heard Beth say the word, work.

Matt was certain Beth, or Andy had mentioned where she worked, but it escaped him. The force of her foot pressing the accelerator kept Matt from being able to think clearly. Worse still when Beth stomped heavily on the brake to stop.

As the drive, and Matt's torture continued he kept trying to recall Beth's job. Admittedly it seemed a dumb thing to focus on, but Matt hated not being able to recall something. Also, it help distract him from the reality of being trapped under her toes.

Finally reaching her destination Beth turned the engine off. The few moments that her foot simply rest on the floorboard was a great relief to Matt. So much so that as Beth opened her car door to stand he remembered her job. Beth was....
1442221112212221232.title: To work.

14422211122122212322.content:
Matt was not mentally prepared to be under Beth's toes for an entire shift. He knew she would be on her feet for the better part of eight hours. "Let me out! Please Beth!" He cried out, writhing under her heavy toes.

Even without being able to hear his cries Beth responded to his movements. Effortlessly clenching her toes she immediately put an end to Matt's protest. As she walked inside the Denny's she continued to put extra weight on her right foot with each step.

Time passed slowly inside the shoe for Matt. Minutes seemed like hours, the hours like days. No matter how much time passed by Beth never seemed to grow tired of toying with him. As she stood at a booth taking orders she constantly tapped her foot. Each rise and fall of her toes shaming Matt to his core. Occasionally she would pop her heel out of the moccasin allowing cool fresh air to enter. This was a blessing, but also caused the sweat Matt was soaked in to congeal.

Finally Beth sat down in the back for her lunch break. Matt felt her toes clench around him before she pulled off her moccasin. She plucked Matt from under her toes with her left hand, dangling him roughly by his ankle. "Bet you wished you treated your friends better now?" She said mockingly.

"You don't understand! Just call Andy, please!" Matt cried out as he hung upside down.

Beth's eyes narrowed as she leaned into Matt. "Shush, I didn't say you could speak." She said in a low threatening tone.

The angry giantess mercilessly dropped Matt back into her sweat soaked moccasin. As her foot shot down Matt frantically scurried towards the toe box. To his horror he never made it before her clammy sole rolled over him. Dropping her heel in place Beth trapped a splayed Matt under the ball of her foot.

As she pushed to her feet Matt screamed into the matted fur insole. Her meaty flesh molded around him like putty. Somehow as she took her first step Matt wasn't crushed. Through the intense pain Matt realized there must have been more side effects to the antidote.

Above Beth was shocked that Matt wasn't crushed under her foot. This unexpected development only excited her further. With her new toy under foot she returned to work eager to finish her shift. As soon as she was done with work Beth planned to...
14422211122122212322.title: A waitress at a Denny's.

choices: Use you as my tiny spy.
144222111221222123221.content:
Matt lay on the cold floor for several moments before realizing he had been dumped out of the moccasin. His entire body protested movement as he slowly pushed back to his feet. He craned his neck up to see the still towering Beth above him.

She stared down at him with a crooked smile. "You're a very comfortable insole." She said. "It definitely made being on my feet all day more enjoyable." Her toes wiggling excitedly as she spoke.

"Beth, you've had your fun. Please just call Andy!" Matt called up, still hoping to return to normal.

Beth rolled her eyes before effortlessly knocking Matt back with her big toe. "Maybe I'll call Andy soon," She said lowering her big toe onto Matt's chest. "But you have to so something first."

Matt groaned as her toe pressed down with more and more pressure. "What's that ?" He croaked out as loudly as he could.

Lifting her toe off of Matt, Beth set her still sweaty feet in front of him. "You're going to worship me, starting with my feet." She said. "Kiss my feet, now." She ordered.

Matt struggled back to his feet. "What!? Are you insane ? I'm not kissing your disgusting feet!" He protested defiantly.

Without hesitation Beth's foot shot out hitting Matt with extreme force. The tiny teen was sent tumbling across the floor. Before he even came to a stop Beth was on top of him. He looked up in time to see her rough heel lowering down. "Wait! Stop!" He screamed.

Ignoring his cries Beth set her heel down on his entire body. She added more and more pressure as she twisted it back and forth. "You're pretty tough Matt. Do you think you could handle me stomping on you right now?" She asked, raising her heel above Matt.

"No, no, don't stomp on me, please!" He screamed out knowing he'd be crushed instantly.

Beth's foot drop next to Matt's cowering body. "Kiss my feet, and call me your Goddess."

Begrudgingly Matt crawled over to Beth's feet and began kissing the salty flesh. "Thank you for not stomping on me Goddess." He called out between kisses.

Beth stared down in pure excitement. She was elated to have a tiny foot slave. "Lick them." She ordered, giggling as she felt Matt's tongue run across her toes.

Matt wanted to scream in anger, but he knew Beth would end him. He continued to obey her commands as if she was a Goddess. Because until he could come up with an escape plan she might as well be one.

Beth grinned widely as she watched Matt. "Okay, now that we've established the proper pecking order I think I should....
144222111221222123221.title: Make Matt worship her feet.

1442222.content:
As poor Matt regains his human faculties, he recognizes he is stuck. His tiny fly form seems trapped in a network of sticky threads.

He tries to fly, but his wings, although they buzz furiously, fail to dislodge his body.

"Where am I?" Matt tries to determine.

He manages to see that the sticky cables are anchored between the branches of a small shrub.

"Oh no!" Matt begins to see the overall shape of the trap. During his stay in complete fly form, he blundered into a spider's web.

He struggles with more strength to free himself.

"Help me!" Matt tries to scream. "Help meee..."
1442222.title: Blundering

choices: Kellie sees the tiny fly in the web
14422221.content:
Matt struggled valiantly, but he could not break his tiny fly body free from the sticky silken cords of the spider's woven trap.

Suddenly, the entire web swayed as the air stirred as two colossal girls walked past his position.

Matt saw his sister's friends, Julie and Samantha.

"Help!" Matt tried to cry out. "Please, help me!"

The two girls, whispering and giggling, walked past the shrub holding the spider's cobweb.

"No! Don't leave me here!" Matt cried, although the only noise he was capable of producing consisted of his buzzing wings.

Then, to his shock, his sister Kellie came into view.

Matt felt his hopes soar. She could save him.

"Kellie, please," the tiny fly boy hoped. "Look for me!"
14422221.title: A Little Help?

144222211.content: "Hey! Look at this little fly. It's trying to free itself from this spider web." Kellie said. Julie and Samantha appeared into view with disgusted looks on their billboard sized faces. "EWWW" said Julie. "Look at that ugly spider!" She pointed at the bottom of the web. "EWWWWWWWWWW!!!" Said all three girls as their voices echoed and slightly vibrated the web. "HELP! Pleasezzz! Help me! KELLIE ITS ME YOUR BROTHER, PLEASEZZZZZZ HELP ME!" Screamed and buzzed poor little Matt. The girls unfortunately couldn't recognize him or hear his pleas. All they heard was buzzing. Kellie pointed her finger right at Matt, "I feel bad. Should I free him?" Matt buzzed, "PLEASEZZZZZZ KELLIE QUICK HELP!" But Julie grabbed Kellie's wrist and pulled it down, "NO WAY! Look, the spider is moving towards it! EWWW! You might touch the spider!" Samantha added, "Yeah Kel, besides, it's just a stupid fly! It deserves what it gets for flying into that web." The spider was almost touching Matt as he screamed some more! "I guess your right." said Kellie. Suddenly all three girls faces disappeared, as they walked away leaving the spider to be free to eat Matt. Last thing Matt heard before the spider munched away, was Julie's voice, "yeah, it's not like it was a tiny person or something, just a fly."
144222211.title: Kellie sees the tiny fly in the web

144222212.content:
As Kellie walked past without seeing him Matt's panic swelled.

"Wait! Please come back!" He pleaded.

He buzzed with his wings as forcefully as possible to escape. This unfortunately made it obvious that the web was no abandoned.

A monstrous spider several times the fly boy's size emerged from the darkness of the shrub.

Matt screamed in horror as the web began to pull under the spider's weight. The hungry beast made its way towards the trapped prey.

"I'm going to leave Matt a note, in case he comes home." Kellie said, as she rushed past unaware of her brother's plight.

Matt's hope returned a hundred fold. "Kellie!" He screamed.

"Just hurry up!" Samantha groaned impatiently as she and Julie came to stand next to the web.

"Help!" Matt begged. "Look down!"

Samantha turned, her phone in hand illuminating the Bush. "Eww, gross." She squealed, noticing the web.

The web had been damaged in the weather, thankfully slowing the spider's approach.

Over her initial shock, Samantha leaned in closer. "This ugly spider is about to eat this little fly" she pointed out to Julie.

"Aww, poor little guy" Julie said, staring at the tiny fly boy.

"Julie! Samantha!" Matt buzzed with all his energy.

The spider had come to a stop, not comfortable with the attention of the giantesses.

A disappointed Samantha noticed the spider's delay. "C'mon, eat it." She prodded.

Julie scolded her. "That's mean. Maybe we should help the little thing out."
144222212.title: Kellie doesn't see him

1442222122.content:
Samantha grabbed a small stick from the ground. With a devious grin she swept the stick across the web. Both spider and fly boy Matt were taken off guard by the sudden act.

The already damaged web was effortlessly destroyed. The spider and would be prey tumbled down onto the walkway below.

Matt landed with a thud, still loosely bound by sticky webbing. The spider landed a couple feet away.

"Ugh, what'd you do that for ?" Julie asked groaning.

Samantha shrugged as she brought her sneaker down on the spider. "What, I saved the stupid little fly. Didn't I." She said amused.

Matt managed to get back onto his six tiny feet. His wings buzzing wildly to remove the remaining spider web.

Seeing the tiny fly struggling Samantha moved over it. She raised her foot preparing to crush it like the spider.

"That's not saving it!" Julie scolded.

Samantha set her foot back down without crushing Matt. "What, its wings are obviously trashed. This is the humane thing to do." Samantha said matter-of-factly.

"C'mon, just leave it alone, Kellie's coming now." Just said aggravated as she motioned towards the returning Kellie.

Samantha rolled her eyes and stepped over the fly, instead of on it. "Whatever, killjoy." She said under her breath.

Matt was thankful that Julie intervened. He was very much tired of being at the mercy of giantesses.

He saw his giantess sister returning. Buzzing loudly, trying to fly Matt was desperate to get her attention. His wings seemed to be finally working properly as Kellie moved towards him.

"Okay, I left Matt a note, if he ever bothers to show up." She said, unaware of the fly Samantha left to struggle on the ground.

"Kellie!" Matt screamed just beginning to take flight. He was less than an inch off of the ground when Kellie made it to him. He attempted to dodge, but his wings weren't up to aggressive maneuvers.

Kellie didn't even notice the tiny fly as she walked past. As she casually moved to meet back up with her friends her right foot landed on Matt. His body was instantly crushed, and left smeared in her tread.

"Okay, let's get going." She said. "We can't waste any more time on Matt."
1442222122.title: Samantha has her own plan

choices: Two junior high boys are collecting spiders for class
Matt managed to partly free himself from the web
14422222.content:
As he struggled, he attracted the attention of the web's spinner and occupant.

From a hidden silk pouch, a hideous arachnid descended on a thin filament of silk.

The little fly-boy struggled even harder when his eyes focused on the monstrosity. Each of the spider's spiky legs manipulated different strands of silk as the creature navigated the web-trap.

The spider had a bloated, bulbous body covered with shaggy fur. As it neared the ensnared fly-boy, Matt could see the spider's lethal-looking fangs.

He knew this was the end when...
14422222.title: Spider in the web

choices: They take the spider, leave Matt
They free Matt, and take the spider
144222221.content:
"Help me!" Matt fought to scream as the two enormous middle-school boys walked toward him.

"Look at that one," the taller boy said, pointing at the spider.

His friend peered into the web. "Oh, it has caught itself a meal."

"Maybe we should let it eat, Trevor, and then collect it."

"Meal? Eat?" Matt thought. "No, you can't let that monster eat me!"

He struggled in the web, as the spider crawled closer.

"Don't just stand there!" Matt cried to Trevor and his friend. "Please, save me!"
144222221.title: Collectors

1442222212.content:
Trevor reacted without hesitation, plucking Matt from the web using two fingers.

Fly-boy Matt was thrilled until the action almost crushed him. As he was trying to buzz an angry protest, the gigantic boy deposited him inside a glass jar and screwed on a metal lid.

At least the boys had thought ahead and punched air holes in the lid.

That's when Trevor's friend collected the spider in another jar.

"Now, we have something to feed him when we get back home," Trevor said, holding up the jar with the fly.

"No!" Matt buzzed around in the big jar. "I'm not food for a stupid spider!"

"We're lucky. This kind's easy to feed in captivity. We just have to give him something that's alive and moving!"

He shook the jar, as if to confirm you're alive and moving.
1442222212.title: They free Matt, and take the spider

14422222121.content: The two boys continued their search for more spiders but couldn’t find any. Trev suggested they head back to his house. His friend agreed. So the two boys walked back home with the fly (being Matt) and the spider. When they arrived at Trevs house they went straight to his room. Matt was quickly placed on the bedside table in his jar, the spider was placed next to him. 'This can’t be how I die' matt told himself. When the two boys were all sorted they headed over to the two jars.
14422222121.title: Back to Trev's house

choices: Have some fun at bug's expense
144222221211.content: When the two boys saw the two jars Matt noticed a look of disappointment on their faces. 'Oh no it’s dead' said Trev. 'Oh' said his friend. Matt was relieved. He thought he would be let go now. 'What are we going to do about that little bug now' said trevs friend. 'We could let him go?' Said Trev. Matt was happy with this idea. It meant living slightly longer. 'No, hey doesnt your mom have bug traps all over the house?' Said Trevs friend. 'Yeah' said Trev. 'Well let’s just put it on one of the traps then leave it, your mom can deal with it later.' Trev thought about it.
144222221211.title: Spider is dead

1442222212111.content:
'Alright' said the boy. So the two picked up Matt's jar and walked out to go find one of their mum's traps. Matt all the time they were doing this was terrified.

'Hey there’s one, lets use it' said Trev. The boys marched over and crouched down near the sticky celletape on the floor. 'Now let’s just put the fly on their and mom will get it later and dispose of it' said Trev. 'Good idea' said his friend. So Trev turned the jar upside down and stuck his fingers in to try to get the fly. Matt attempted to dodge the boys sweaty huge fingers and nearly succeded. However, just as he got out, he was pinched by Trevs fingers and his wings were broken. Matt screamed in pain but all that came out was 'buzzz'.

'Gotcha' said Trev. His friend laughed. Trev Crouched down and maxed matt on the sticky trap. Matt was instantly paralysed by the glue substance. 'That should do' said Trev's friend. They both walked off and played computer games in trevs room.
1442222212111.title: Traps

choices: That was it for poor Matt
14422222121111.content:
Later on that day, the mom arrived back. She checked Matt's trap after being informed by Trev and saw Matt.

Without thinking she picked up the sticky glue with Matt and a few other dead bugs on. Rolled it up and put it in the toilet. She flushed the chain and that was that.
14422222121111.title: Mums home

144222221211112.content:
Trev's mom didn't notice a tiny black fly tumble off of the trap as she lifted it into the air. She flushed the trap, ant turned to leave the bathroom.

Matt landed on the ground, instantly trying to take flight. Panic surged when he realized his wings were immobile, coated in glue from the trap.

"Oh no!" Matt cried as he began to move his six tiny legs.

Trev's mom turned, her barefoot hovering over the handicapped fly.

Matt looked up in horror as her sole blocked out the sky.
144222221211112.title: Escapes

1442222212111121.content:
