His luck almost immediately went for good to bad. The barefoot slammed down on top of the fly boy. To his shock he wasn't crushed, instead stuck between her big toe and the next.

Trev's mom didn't notice the fly between her toes, adhering to her flesh because of the trap. She walked out of the bathroom towards the kitchen.

"Hey! Stop!" Matt screamed.

He started to try to pull free, but the giantess interpreted his movements as a slight tickle. He toes wiggled in response, nearly crushing Matt.

With great willpower Matt tried to stay perfectly still. He hoped that the glue would fade, leaving him to escape.

After finishing up in the kitchen Trev's mom went upstairs to change. The movements shock and twisted Matt's fleshy prison. Somehow he remained alive.

Panic set in however as Matt realized the giantess was pulling on a thick pair of socks. The dense fabric blocked out almost all light, and kept in nearly all the heat.

Returning downstairs the giantess sat down on the couch and kicked her feet up on the ottoman. Flexing her toes as small amounts of sweat began to form she unknowing loosened Matt's sticky restraints.

"Oh crap." Matt said realizing that being loose inside the sock wasn't probably the best option.

Over time with heat build up, and the occasional foot shift Matt was fully free of the glue. He deftly clung to the inside of the sock, hoping not to draw her attention.

Even as the giantess stood to leave the room Matt held on. Making constant adjustments to avoid touching her skin.

"Socks were a bad idea." She said unceremoniously pulling the socks off as walking into her bedroom.

Matt was still inside the heavy, now damp sock as she held it and its mate in her hand. Without warning the giantess roughly balled the socks up in her hand. She tossed them, along with a crushed Matt into her hamper.
1442222212111121.title: Squashed

1442222212111122.content:
Matt froze as the foot flattened on top of him. Instead of being crushed, he was safe under the giantess' high arch.

He didn't move until she stepped out of the room, closing the door behind her. Matt wasn't worried about being trapped. He could clearly see a large gap at the base of the door.

Crawling out, and taking flight he knew he had to find a way out quickly. He was pretty sure he was still in his neighborhood. So finding his way home wouldn't be too hard.

Flying high to avoid detection Matt was lucky to find an unlit fireplace. He dove quickly inside and up the chimney.
1442222212111122.title: Near Miss

choices: He's free but falls because of his broken wings
14422222121112.content:
Matt had time to contemplate his fate. For a while, there was nothing else he could do except contemplate his fate. But that is when he noticed that he still had hands. He wondered whether he had hands all along and only now noticed them or if somehow he got hands back meaning the formula might be wearing off. Whichever way it was it meant that Matt wasn't completely fly, at least not yet.

He wondered if he had any other human qualities as well. His hands were black and jointed so didn't look human but he at least had an opposable thumb to work with his otherwise fused fingers. He was able to grab and break off the leg of a nearby dead fly. It was gruesome work as Matt realized the leg he was using as a tool was just like one of his own current legs. Using this tool though, Matt began freeing himself. He got his upper body free.
14422222121112.title: It’s a miracle

144222221211122.content:
The more Matt struggled, the more his body burned through the formula still in his bloodstream.

Without even knowing it, Matt gradually grew back to normal, changing back to human from a fly.

He did not, however, grow.

He remained a tiny, insect-sized teenager, even after he escaped the loathsome glue trap.

"It's better than being a bug," he decided.

About then, he felt the floor shake. "An earthquake?" Matt reacted.

No, not an earthquake. Trev was returning to the kitchen.

"Now is my chance!" Matt cried and ran toward the enormous boy.

"Hey! Look down!" Matt screamed. "See me! I shrunk! I need help!"

Trev focused on his task, which was to grab a soda and get back to his friend for video games.

When his screams went unheard, Matt froze. "He can't hear me!"

The giant sneakers kept slapping the floor on a path coming directly toward him.

Matt turned and ran in the other direction, but a dark shadow overtook him.

Turning, Matt saw the sneaker's sole descending.

"No!" Matt cried. "Don't step on...."

SQUISH!

Trev grabbed his soda and returned to the rec room. He never even noticed he had stepped on a bug-sized person who had invented a shrink ray, experimented with it, and paid the price.
144222221211122.title: Trev comes back

choices: Matt tries to avoid getting swept up
Matt tries to avoid getting swept up -- another version
145.content:
"MATT? YOU DOWN HERE?" A deep, thundering voice boomed overhead. Heavy footsteps pounded the wooden steps that led down to the basement. It was the voice of Matt's older brother, Shawn, who was home from college on break. Shawn and Shawn's friend, Trey, had just returned from playing basketball at the park nearby. Shawn was the jock of the family, tall and well-built. Trey was about the same size as Shawn, who was six foot-two and about 190-200 pound weight range. Shawn was 19, and Trey was probably about the same age. Both of the young men were still sweaty from their game, both wore sleeveless t-shirts. Shawn wore dark green basketball shorts, an oatmeal gray sleeveless tee, and a well-worn pair of high-top Nike 'Air Force Ones', which were white with gray. Trey wore a white tee, navy blue shorts, and a pair of low-cut 'Nike Shox' running shoes.

Shawn and Trey reached the basement and stopped. They looked around. Shawn saw a pile of Matt's clothes on the floor. "What kind of freaky @#$! is he into now?" Shawn snorted. "Hey MATT?? Dude, where are you?" Shawn's baritone voice called out. "There's no one in here, man." Trey said, still looking around the lab. The two 19 year old jocks stepped toward the pile of clothes, their sneakers bumped on the basement's concrete floor, oblivious to a strange little bug, trying to dodge their footfall. Shawn crouched and picked up Matt's jeans. He pulled the wallet out of the back pocket. "Dude, don't just take the money from him!" said Trey. Shawn opened the wallet and snatched out a $20 bill. "He ain't here to ask." Shawn wanted to borrow money from his brother. "Hell, the little dork owes me more that this! He's the one trying to borrow money from either me or mom and dad for his goofy science crap. In fact..." Shawn went ahead and took out another $10 bill, leaving Matt with just $6. Shawn dropped the jeans back on the floor. "Don't know what the kid does down here. Thought he was just a nerd, but hell, looks like he totally stripped naked. Man, I don't even WANNA know!" Shawn continued, as he put the money into his own wallet.

Shawn then stepped over to the work table, where Matt had all of his lab material scattered. Shawn began to snoop, flipping notebooks. Trey stepped over to an old phonograph, the one with the big horn for a speaker. "Man, this is older than hell. Where did he get this?" Trey asked. "Dunno. Some yard sale. He's a nerd. He collects things like that. Uses the parts for his geeky projects I guess." As Shawn finished flipping through the notebook, his hand bumped a jar of iron fillings. It fell from the table and broke on the floor with a loud crash. "Aw @#$%!" exclaimed Shawn.

"Nice move!" Trey said sarcastically, chuckling. "Shut up!" smiled Shawn, punching Trey in the arm hard, but in a good natured sort of way. Trey pushed back, and the two young men wrestled around for a bit, not paying much attention to the 1/2 inch tall creature, so close to their colossal shoes. After the young men were down horsing around, Shawn walked around the basement, looking for a broom and dustpan. He found one. Shawn then kicked aside Matt's clothes and was about to sweep up the iron filings and broken glass, scattered everywhere...
145.title: Something else

choices: Matt finds a way out of the trash can
1451.content:
The voice of his older brother, Shawn, thundered across the basement. Matt covered his ears. He felt tremors...these tremor shook more and more, until Matt was nearly knocked over. Two colossal pairs of feet stomped down the steps and across the concrete floor. The sneaker soles of the giants bumped along the floor, dull and heavily. Soon, the terrified Matt was looking up the toe of his brother's colossal Nike 'Air Force One' high top. The sole alone was twice as tall as Matt was! To Matt, Shawn and Trey towered like skyscrappers hundreds of feet tall. "SHAWN!! SHAWN!!! TREY!!! DOWN HERE!" Matt cried frantically, he ran up to his brother's sneaker sole and banged on it. But it was no use. Poor Matt was far too small to be heard or seen. Just then, the shoe lifted, as Matt was thrown back. Matt saw his brother crouch down and grab his clothes. And Matt saw Shawn grab Matt's wallet and swipe the money. "HEY!! HEY!! WHAT ARE YOU DOING?? DON'T STEAL MY MONEY, YOU JERK!!" he ran toward his brother, but then stopped cold. He slapped himself in the head, "Stupid! What can I do. Like I can stop him. I don't think I could stop him if I were my NORMAL size!" Matt was frantic...he can't believe he got himself into this.

Matt saw his brother and Trey snoop around his lab, his sanctuary! "STOP IT! YOU GUYS, STOP. GO AWAY!" Matt whined. Matt sat down on a pencil that was lying on the floor. He had tears. Matt knew he couldn't live in the world at this size for long. He had never been so scared in his life. Suddenly, a loud BANG!! Matt was knocked clean off of the pencil and thrown back on the floor. The force of the jar of iron filings falling knocked the tiny teenager off his bearing. He laid flat on the floor on covered his head. Thank God none of the gigantic shards of glass landed on him. Several iron filings covered him, but they were light weight. "Oh @@#@$%!" exclaimed Matt. "My stupid brother is going to wreck my whole lab!" Still worse, Shawn and Trey were wrestling around. Trey's massive Nike running shoe nearly stomped poor Matt. Matt began to run for cover. "Those big @#$%^ idiots are going to stomp on me yet! It's like Gozilla and King Kong going at it!!" Matt yelled.

To Matt horror, a massive object cut off his path. He looked up...it was the biggest broom he had ever seem!! The bristles towered several stories! And the broom was coming toward him. There was no way he could outrun it. The massive broom caught Matt up among the iron filing, glass, and other debris on the floor. Matt hung onto the bristles for dear life. Meanwhile, Shawn swept up the mess into a pile. Then, Shawn grabbed the dustpan and brushed the pile onto the dustpan. Meanwhile, Matt's strength was waning. He couldn't hold on any long. He let go, and fell right into the debris that was swept into the dust pan, just as Shawn set the broom aside and picked up the dustpan. The trash can in the basement was heaping full, so Shawn carried the full dustpan upstairs to the kitchen trashcan. Shawn and Trey climbed the steps and into the kitchen. Shawn stepped on the pedal that opened the trash can lid. The tiny teen in the debris was horrified. He tried crying out: "SHAWN!! I'M DOWN HERE! DONT' THROW ME AWAY!!" But it was useless. The half-inch tall teen was now soiled and totally blended in with the iron and dirt in the pan. In fact, if anything, his soiled-dark color made him look more like a bug and a tiny human.

Matt felt everything slide at a steep angle..."AHHHH!!!" cried Matt, as he landed in the almost-full trash can. Fortunately, a balled up wad of paper towel broke his fall. The last sight Matt saw was his brother's face. His brother spit out a wad of gum, and then, everything around Matt went black as the lid slammed shut. Matt lay still for a moment. As his eyes adjusted to the dark, he got up and tried to find a way out. He overheard his brother outside say something about taking the trash out. Matt stumbled around in the dark. Suddenly he tripped over something and landed in something warm, wet, and extremely sticky. Mat knew what it was...it was Shawn's gum. Matt swore and he tried to free himself...
1451.title: Matt tries to avoid getting swept up

choices: Shawn builds a small doll house for them
Their new home is his Nike hi-tops.
14513.content:
As Matt struggled with the sticky gum, he overheard Shawn say something about going back downstairs. Then he heard footfall leading to the stairway, and then clatter of giant shoes hitting each step. Matt was left in the dark trash can all alone, and as time passed his eyes continued to adjust to the dark. His mind turned the objects in the trash can with him into mysterious creatures, and he was becoming even more terrified. Eventually he tried moving again, but alas he was stuck in place by his brother's chewed gum.

Suddenly can he hear from the basement Shawn screaming, "WHOA, DUDE WHAT JUST HAPPENED!!!???" Matt was confused as to what was going on. He heard Shawn say something, but couldn't distinguish it. Then his brother yelled "MATT, IF YOU'RE SHRUNK, COME OUT. I'M GOING TO TRY TO FIND YOU." "So Trey must have shrunk," thought Matt. After a while of Shawn searching around the basement, Matt heard him slowly come up the stairs. Shawn must have been watching each of his steps. The footfall came closer to the garbage can.

When Shawn lifted the lid of the trash can, Matt involuntarily closed his eyes to protect them from the great light. Shawn muttered under his breath, "Man, I must have swepted him up." Matt hoped that Shawn would see him attached to the chewed up gum, but his titanic brother's eyes glazed right over him. Suddenly two hands reached out and began shifting the objects in the trash can. Matt was tossed up and down as his brother searched. Eventually Shawn's arm pushed aside a paper near Matt, and got stuck to the gum in the process. Suddenly Matt went into vertigo as the gum moved with his brother's arm. Shawn reached out to pluck away the gum, but as he touched it he noticed that it felt funny. He took a closer look at it and realized that he had found his brother.

"MATT," Shawn exclaimed! "I'm so glad I don't have to scrap you off the bottom of my hi-tops!" Suddenly Shawn stood up, and reached out for a miniature half-inch Trey that was on the counter. He put both of them into the palm of his hand and told them, "Don't worry guys, I'll take care of you both as we figure out what's going. Until then, I'm not going anywhere near the basement, as I like being the big man around here. For now, we can make a home for you two."
14513.title: Fishing for garbage

choices: Shawn tries to find a way to reverse the effect
Shawn wakes up and forgets about his shrunken friend and brother
145132.content:
With his brother and friend in tow, Shawn made the journey upstairs to his bedroom. Upon entering, Trey and Matt were petrified by teenage smell of Shawn's room, which at their magnified scale became a miasma to their noses. Dirty clothes were strewn across the floor, with countless pairs of used socks that reeked of sweat to be found. Shawn went over to his dresser, which was mostly bare save for a deodorant stick and a couple of basketball cards, and placed his two new miniaturized dependents down. Shawn's voice boomed over the two, saying "ALRIGHT, GUYS, I NEED TO FIND A PLACE TO KEEP YOU. I NEED SOMETHING THAT WILL BOTH CONTAIN YOU TWO FROM WONDERING AND KEEP YOU SAFE." Both Matt and Trey gave him a thumbs up, and Shawn left to scourge his room for somewhere to hold them. Matt became walking around the dresser, deciding to get a closer look at the larger-than-life objects. He was absolutely astounded by the sheer size of the basketball card that was next to him. The name of it read "JAKOB POELTL," and the thought that something that was normally a minor object instead was dwarfing him give him a shiver.

After searching through his entire room, Shawn grew frustrated that he couldn't find anywhere to place his brother or friend without suffocating them or keeping them in the dark. Just when he was about to give up, he looked down at his feet and saw his two Nike High-top Air Force Ones. Then it hit him: he could just keep them in his shoes. The opening of the shoes could provide ventilation and a way to bring light down, and the largeness of his feet meant that the two of them would have plenty of space. The nature of the high top also meant that it would be nearly impossible for either one of them to climb out. He also had other high-top shoes that could be used instead, so that way the two could be kept home whenever he went out. He walked over to his dresser, and spoke above the two insect sized people, "I GOT AN IDEA. YOU GUYS ARE GONNA HAVE TO FOLLOW IT, OKAY?" Both Matt and Trey gave a hesitant nod of approval. Then, Shawn sat down on his bed, untied his high-tops, and took them off. Both Matt and Trey were still waiting for Shawn to pull some sort of containment out when he shocked them by standing up, putting the opening of his shoe to the edge of the dresser, and motioned for the two to jump in.

When Matt saw that Shawn intended for him and Trey to live in his high-top, he immediately decided to resist at all costs. But Shawn was persistent, and given his much large size, was able to get his way. Shawn's massive hand descended upon the two and swept them into the high-top. Both Matt and Trey fell directly into the shoe, and once they hit the bottom they were confronted with sweat that oozed out. "Oh man, this is nasty!" cried Matt. Trey tried to communicate with his giant friend by yelling, "The smell is awful, man!", but his voice was too weak for Shawn's ears to pick it up. Shawn then walked over to his closet, sat his pair of Nikes down, and told his miniature captives, "DON'T WORRY, LITTLE GUYS. I'LL TAKE CARE OF YOU. SOON I'LL FIND A YOU WAY TO GET YOU TWO BACK TO NORMAL." Then Shawn got up, walked over to his bed, pulled out his phone, and started to research a plan to try to reverse the shrinking effect, only to fall asleep within a couple of minutes. Matt and Trey were left to loaf around their new, foul odored prison to talk about how they shrunk.
145132.title: Their new home is his Nike hi-tops.

choices: Shawn remembers where Trey and Matt are
Shawn gives up and just tries to regrow Connor and Brandon
1451322.content:
Matt and Trey spent what felt like eternity waiting. Hearing the loud snores, they realized that Shawn had fallen asleep. But about an hour later, the titan awoke. Scratching his head, Shawn checked his phone that was sitting next to him. He had received a couple of messages from his friends. "MAN, WHAT WAS I DOING?", he questioned. Sitting up, he realized that his mind was blank. Then he thought of shrunken Trey and Matt, only to deduce that it was some strange dream. He walked out to the bathroom to splash water on his face, with each of his footsteps being heard like thunder to the minuscule ears of Matt and Trey. Shawn went back into his room and texted his friend Brandon to see if he wanted to shoot some hoops. While waiting for a response, Shawn grabbed his favourite game shoes, the Nike Air Force Ones. Unbeknownst to him, Matt and Trey were in his right shoe. First, Shawn began putting on and tying up his left shoe. By this point, his brother and friend figured out the giant's oblivion. Acting quickly, the two insect-sized boys run to the toe section of the high-top. Thankfully Shawn was still groggy from his sleep, so they had extra time to reach the ending. Both Matt and Trey watched in horror as a massive athletic socked foot descended into the chamber. Instantly the potency of the stench multiplied exponentially. Matt knew that Shawn had the habit of reusing socks without washing them, and with their luck this bad boy's been out for a while. The sock, which was so massive it seemed like a monster to the two, moved quickly towards them. Right when it was encroaching, it suddenly stopped. The two shrunken teenagers were so close they could reach out and touch Shawn's building sized foot, but the little gap in which they existed meant that they would be safe.

With each step Shawn took, Trey and Matt were subjected to a thrilling ride. Up-down-up-down they went, and were able to hear in great detail every minuscule noise Shawn took. Eventually Brandon showed up, and Matt and Trey got the experience of being a fly on the wall as the two titans conversed. In the dark prison, the two insect teens heard everything from conversations about girls, slams of car doors, burbs, until they finally heard the bounce of a basketball. Both the dribble of the basketball and the squeak of the shoes created a dissonance of sounds that forced them to cover their ears. But the longer the game went on, the more Shawn's feet sweated. The humidity inside the shoe skyrocketed, and the temperature became hotter than an August afternoon. In addition to the mugginess, the sweat accumulated so much that both Matt and Trey felt like they were swimming in Shawn's perspiration. Shawn and Brandon played for another two hours, which seemed to pass on like an eternity for the insect-sized teens. At some point a mutual friend of Shawn and Brandon, Connor, showed up, and the group continued their fun.

Once the three titans were finished playing basketball, they all headed back to Shawn's house to relax and hang out. The three of them put their feet up as they watched some pre-season football, but inside Shawn's shoe was Matt and Trey trying to balance themselves on Shawn's toes. Brandon and Connor both wanted a soda, so Shawn told them to help themselves from the fridge in the basement. Trey and Matt gulped when they heard the unaware jocks descend the wooden stairs. Then, over the sound of the TV, Matt could hear what sounded like whipping noise. "Those two imbeciles must be playing with my clothes!", cried Matt. Suddenly, they hear Connor yell, "WHOA, WHERE DID YOU GO?". Then, within a minute in typical fashion, Connor shouts, "SHAWN, YOU GOTTA COME DOWN HERE! BRANDON JUST DID A MAGIC TRICK!". Grumbling, Shawn gets up off the couch, sending his two captives in motion hitting the walls of the shoe. Heavy footsteps on each wooden step ringed in Matt's and Trey's hears. "WHAT"S UP MAN?", asked Shawn. "LOOK AT THIS!", replied Connor, who then handed Shawn a miniature Brandon that waved upward. Connor continued, "HE POINTED ME TO RIGHT HERE. CHECK THIS OUT, BRO." Then Connor reached out to touch the red shrinking solution. Shawn, realizing what was going on, tried to shout, "NO, DON'T DO IT!", but was cut off by the instant miniaturization of his basketball friend. He then walked over to Connor's clothes that were on the floor, and shuffled through them until he found his insect-sized friend.

With both tiny Connor and Brandon in hand, he tried to jog his memory. He knew that both Matt and Trey had shrunk, but he couldn't remember where he put them. He went into his room, put his friends on his dresser, sat down, and tried to figure out what had happened and what to do.
1451322.title: Shawn forgets Matt and Trey

choices: The security team spots something in his bag
14513221.content:
“OH CRAP!” Shawn yelled as he suddenly remembered where Trey and Matt had gone. Carefully he took his shoe off and gently tilted it causing Matt and trey to spill down from the toe to the heel, then he tipped them into his palm.

Matt gasped in the fresh air as he landed in the palm of his brother. He looked up at the giant to see a sheepish smile across his brothers face, Shawn looked at the two and said “SORRY ABOUT THAT YOU TWO”. This infuriated Matt and he yelled up at the giant “Sorry! That’s all you have to say?! 1. You could have killed Trey and I and 2. That’s a bloody disgusting place to put us in the first place you idiot!”. Shawn’s smile fell as he lifted them closer. “RELAX MAN, LOOK AT TREY HE IS JUST ENJOYING HIS LITTLE VACATION WITH NO RESPONSIBILITIES, PLUS WE HAVE BIGGER PROBLEMS NOW, YOU’RE FORMULA SHRUNK CONNER AND BRANDON AS WELL AND WE ARNE’T GONNA HAVE A VERY GOOD BASKETBALL SEASON IF HALF THE TEAM IS ONLY THE SIZE OF A BUG” Shawn’s three friends laugh at this which just fills Matt with more anger. Shawn can clearly see this and says “MATT, LITTLE DUDE, IT’S ALL GOOD BRO. I HAVE A PLAN TO GET ALL 4 OF YOU BACK TO NORMAL. YOU’LL JUST HAVE TO TRUST ME OK?”

Matt hated how relaxed his brother and three tiny friends were but knew he couldn’t change anything. “WHAT’S YOUR PLAN SHAWN?” He yelled up at his brother. “ OK HEAR ME OUT LITTLE DUDES, MY UNIVERSITY HAS A REALLY GREAT SCIENCE PROGRAM AND I’VE GOT A FEW FRIENDS INVOLVED IN IT SO ALL I GOTTA DO IS TAKE THE FOUR OF YOU TO COLLEGE WITH ME, THEN ONCE THE ANTIDOTE IS PERFECTED CONNER TREY AND BRANDON ALL JUST STAY THERE SINCE THEY GO TO UNI THERE AND WE SEND YOU BACK MATT” Matt thinks about it and then realizes a major problem “You go to the school on the other side of the country”
“ I GUESS WELL JUST HAVE TO HAVE A FUN TRAVEL DAY THEN, I BETTER GET PACKING” Shawn says.

Before you know it Shawn is fully packed and driving you to the airport, “THE GOOD NEWS IS WE CAN STAY IN MY DORM SINCE I WAS HEADED BACK THIS WEEK ANYWAY”. As Shawn walks to security he whispers to the four of you “OK guys I’m gonna put you in a shoe in my carry on so you make it through security” Matt dreads the idea of going back in a shoe but can’t stop it and is placed in the shoe with the other three teens.

As Shawn walks through security...
14513221.title: Shawn remembers where Trey and Matt are

choices: Garbage can outside on the porch
Garbage can upstairs in the kitchen
Garbage can next to the nerd's desk
1452.content:
As tiny Matt faced the huge bristles in the oncoming broom, he flashed back to how he had ended up in such a predicament.

First, his situation had gone from very bad to very, very bad with the arrival of his older brother, Shawn, and his brother's fellow jock, Trey.

For the puny teen, finding himself on the floor at the massive sneakers of these mighty titans was an unexpectedly nightmarish situation.

At first, failing to recognize his peril, Matt rushed toward the basement stairs, screaming his brother's name at the top of his voice. "Shawn! Help me! Please, look down!" Matt implored. "I'm here! On the floor!"

Then, Shawn's well-worn pair of high-top Nike Air Force Ones hit the basement floor as he stepped off the bottom step. For little Matt, the result was worse than any earthquake. The impact of a simple footfall knocked him off his feet and flat on his butt. Before the insect-sized youth could get back on his feet, Trey's low-cut Nike Shox running shoes landed on the basement floor and triggered a second massive aftershock.

The two giants continued to stomp through the lab, and they also found Matt's discarded clothing. As the half-inch tall guy watched, they pawed through his belongings, even stealing money from his wallet.

Terrified of getting stomped, however, Matt could do little more than try to avoid the gigantic sneakers. He thought the worst was over when one of the titans knocked the jar of iron fillings off the desk.

A fraction closer, the impact would have obliterated the tiny man. As it was, Matt was so frightened by the close call that he could barely move.

Then, the shrunken teen saw something that gave him the motivation to move.

His towering brother had grabbed a huge broom. "I BETTER SWEEP THIS %^&* OFF THE FLOOR, OR I WILL CATCH IT FROM MY NERD BROTHER!"

The bristles swooshed across the floor, sweeping everything, the iron fillings, shards of glass and one unseen tiny teen, into a tidy pile.

Trey helped out his buddy by grabbing a dust pan and holding it on the floor.

Shawn swept the mess onto the dust pan, which Trey lifted."WHERE'S YOUR TRASH CAN, MAN?"

Unnoticed, tiny Matt tried to climb through the piles of debris. He waved his hands over his head and screamed. "No! Shawn! Please, I'm here! Don't toss me out with the garbage!"

Shawn answered in a booming voice. "TOSS IT INTO THE GARBAGE CAN..."
1452.title: No Escape from the Broom

14521.content:
Shawn gestured toward the door at the back of his brother's basement laboratory. "There's a garbage can outside on the back porch," he told his friend.

Trey carried the dust pan toward the door, never taking the time to notice the tiny form, surrounded by iron fillings, broken glass and other litter, waving up at him, desperate for notice.

"No!" Matt shouted. "Please don't dump me outside!"

He knew he would likely never survive getting tossed outdoors with the trash. Some horrible insect or fearsome creature would be sure to eat him as quite the tasty morsel.

He ran toward the edge of the dust tray. If he dropped, he might not survive the fall, but the alternative seemed even worse.

Mustering up his strength, he took a leap of faith.

His leap carried him farther than he anticipated. With a soft thud, he landed on...
14521.title: Out with Trash?

choices: Stay on the socks and wait for Trey to find them
Find the remainders of the shrinking formula and dispose of it
1453.content: Shawn accidentally touches a tiny drop of shrinking formula and instantly he shrinks, joining his shrunken brother on the ground. Trey, witnessing what happened, deduced that Matt shrunk too. Trey's voiced boomed to the two shrunken boys, "HEY YOU TWO, ARE YOU OKAY!?" as he said that, he took off his shoes and walked around with his long white sports socks.. almost 3/4 knee socks. Both Shawn and Matt managed to find each other on Shawn's smelly black sports socks. They both then decided to..
1453.title: Something else

choices: Andy and Kellie enter the lab
Kellie and some of her friends enter the lab
15.content:
Matt felt very strange as he opened his eyes. He felt a heavy weight pressing down on him and found himself in darkness.

He could not stand up in his cramped confines, so he crawled forward toward a thin sliver of light.

He reached the opening. Stepping into the light, he found himself without any clothes. “What’s going on?”

He took a look around the lab. Were his eyes tricking him? He looked like he had been transported to some weird alien city. Towering structures surrounded him. “Wait!” He rubbed his eyes. “Those aren’t buildings.”

The formula! It must have worked. He had shrunk!

Why, then, did everything look so unreal? He had trouble focusing his vision on the enormous laboratory. His computer, distant on a mountainous desktop, loomed at the edge of his horizon. Shelves and counters looked like natural features of some majestic landscape.

“Oh crap!” Matt exclaimed. “How small am I?”

He turned and saw a pile of clothing on the floor. His jeans looked like a range of rolling blue denim hills. He realized that he had crawled from beneath the sleeve of his own shirt to find himself lost in this strange gigantic world.

“Everything looks so big!” Matt looked down at the hardwood floor. The cracks between floorboards looked as wide as he was tall.

“I’m not even an inch tall!” Matt exclaimed. Without a more reliable way to determine his height, he estimated he must be about an eighth of an inch tall.

“I’m no more than a speck!” Matt said aloud. His colossal surroundings swallowed up his tiny voice.

No earlier tests had indicated such a dramatic shrinkage.

But, he had proven that his formula worked.

Now all he wanted was the antidote.

“Oh no!” His voice carried a hint of panic. He titled his head back and gazed toward the distant jar with the pale blue liquid, the antidote to his shrinking formula. The jar far, far out of reach on surface of the skycraper-sized table.

Matt felt goosebumps rise on his bare skin. “Oh crap! I’ll never be able to get to it now.”

Scaling the table quickly became the least of his worries when he heard a deafening crash.
15.title: Teeny Tiny Teen

choices: Jump between a crack in the floorboards
151.content:
The boards of the floor vibrated beneath Matt’s tiny bare feet.

“What the...” Matt bit off his words as the titanic figure came into sight.

His friend looked so huge that Matt would have found Andy unreal except for the explosions each of his friend’s enormous footsteps caused as the soles of his sneakers slammed against the unyielding hardwood floor.

Matt started running, but another footstep caused a quake that knocked him flat. He sprawled on the floor and looked as Andy made his way into the lab.

His friend called out Matt’s name in a booming voice.

“Andy!” Matt managed to get back on his feet. He waved his arms over his head. “Andy! Look down! Down here!”

Andy wore a pair of tattered sneakers, baggy jeans and a red T-shirt. His shaggy head of light brown hair cascaded down around his face.

Matt realized his pathetic squeaks failed to carry enough volume to possibly be heard by his friend. Andy looked more than three thousand feet tall!

And his friend stomped across the floor, oblivious to anything in his path.

Matt stared in horror at those sneakers — each almost 500 feet long and 200 feet tall at the ankle. “Andy! Don’t step on me!” Matt screamed as loudly as he could.

As if following a script, Andy turned and headed toward the very spot on the floor where his tiny friend stood frozen in a terrified stupor.

No way out! Matt looked around, but found himself caught in the open with his titanic friend bearing down on him.
151.title: Andy

choices: Try to reach the computer to communicate with a mail-friend.
1511.content:
At the last moment, terrified Matt managed to reach his only way to safety: a crack in the foorboard! He jumped into it, and heard his titanic friend going out of the room.
Matt had escaped that danger... but what he was going to do now?
1511.title: Avoiding crushing!

15112.content:
First, Matt crawled out of the crevice between the floorboards.

He felt fortunate to have escaped his close call.

"I better think of a way to get help," he said.

Suddenly, inspiration struck. If he could reach his computer, maybe he could contact someone to help him.

He looked for ways to scale the clifflike side of his desk.

Snaking cables down the back of the computer might provide one method.

His other choice involved climbing onto his bed, via the convenient bedcovers, and then trying to bridge the gulf between the bed and the adjacent desk.
15112.title: Decides to Tackle the Computer

choices: Sprint! As fast you can, run away!
1512.content:
For a split-second, Matt felt as if the world around his had stopped moving completely. Andy's billboard face stared down at him and Matt was ambivalent. Should he run? Or would his best friend recognize him?

Matt held out for more than a terrifying second on the latter before it was proved wrong. Andy's immense voice proclaimed, hundreds of thousands of feet above him, like some kind of a god, "Stupid bug."

Matt's brain barely had time to feel the pain that Andy's deep voice caused to his own tiny ears. Mixed dissapointment and fear swirled around Matt and then he was off -- sprinting as fast he could in the opposite direction.

***

Andy laughed, watching the specksized bug flee. It had barely covered an inch before Andy lifted his Adidas sneakers and slammed them onto the ground. The bug faltered or fell - it was too small, Andy couldn't tell. But he knew how much this lab meant to his friend and how clean he always kept it --

"You're going down, bug," he said, chuckling.

***

Matt rubbed at his leg, which had sustained a bruise from falling on the ground hard. How could his friend do this to him? Already, Andy was beginning to seem less like a pal and more like a gargantuan creature. Andy's shoe, alone, seemed large enough to stomp out Matt's existence.

Speak of the devil! Just as Matt's thoughts left Andy's Adidas, they slammed down in front of him. Matt ignored the pain in his thigh and dived left, only to run into Andy's other shoe, just yards ahead. He dared to look up - only for a second - to see Andy's epic hand coming down on him. He would crush him in a second and never even know!

Matt was almost certain that his friend would help him if he could discover him. But there was no way to get to him from here. He would have to try again, but first he had to make Andy think he wasn't a bug, or at least get away!
1512.title: A Microscopic Mistake

choices: Andy, tired of waiting, leaves Matt trapped
Andy, tired of waiting, takes the bug with him
15121.content:
"Andy!" Matt screamed as his titanic friend's massive hand got closer. "Stop!"

Suddenly, the hand that had plunged tiny Matt into shadow, lifted.

"What gives?" Matt wondered.

But he didn't have very long to wonder.

He heard the rumbling sound of Andy's laughter. "Hey, bug! I'll keep you 'til my buddy gets here. He may want to get a close look at you."

Matt saw an enormous glass container in Andy's hand.

"Noooh!" Matt screamed and started to run. He didn't get far, though, before Andy slammed the glass down on him.

His momentum, however, carried him forward enough for him to crash into the transparent wall. The impact knocked him on his butt. He stared up through the glass prison at the distorted image of his gigantic friend.

"Andy! Let me out!" Matt screamed.

But, Andy, ignoring the bug after trapping it, walked around the lab, no longer curious, only impatient for Matt to arrive and have a look at the weird creature.
15121.title: Trapped

151212.content:
Each step taken by his mammoth friend sent vibrations through the floor that caused an amplified if muffled echo inside the confines of the glass jar.

Matt shouted until he made himself hoarse to get his giant friend’s attention.

Finally, in a blur of action, Andy came to a decision.

“I’VE WAITED LONG ENOUGH,” Andy said.

His enormous arm dropped down from above and his hand lifted the jar. A stunned Matt, too shocked to run, made it easy for his friend to scoop him into a huge fist.

Matt squirmed and kicked, but his body felt pressed from all sides in Andy’s field-sized fist.

With his free hand, Andy recovered the jar and righted it. In another simple motion for him, he opened his fist and dropped the tiny bug into the jar.

Matt screamed until he hit the hard glass at the base of the jar. His head swam through a sea of stars. He looked up to see Andy tighten a massive metal lid on the jar.

Matt awoke, unsure of how long he had been knocked out. He soon ascertained he was still trapped in the jar. He looked around. He saw Andy standing overhead. His friend looked like a mountain.

“Andy!” Matt stood and waved. “Help! Let me out of...”

BAM!

Matt fell to his knees and felt like his head might explode.

He saw a huge pole burst through the metal jar lid.

“THERE!” Andy said. “DON’T WANT YOU TO SUFFOCATE UNTIL I CAN SHOW YOU TO MY BUDDY MATT.”

BAM! BAM!

Andy drove a pencil twice more into the metal jar lid to make sure the weird bug would have enough air for the trip back to his place.

Matt, in real pain, fell to the glass surface beneath his feet and slipped back into a numb limbo.
151212.title: Jarring

choices: Andy takes out a magnifying glass.
1512121.content:
Every step Andy took knocked Matt down to the bottom of the jar again, so he stopped trying to stand upright. He could only lie there and take everything in as Andy headed home.

At least that's where Matt thought Andy was going. From what he could see around the huge fingers gripping half of the jar, he thought he recognized Andy's street.

Andy soon got tired of holding the jar upright and lowered it to his side. Matt screamed again as the jar was tilted to the side. He could defintaely see where they were going through the holes Andy had made in the top of the jar, but he was staying away from that end of the jar. He didn't want to fall out, and he didn't want to fall that far again when Andy tipped the jar back upright.

It was so strange for Matt to be sitting there in a jar with his best friend right there, but with no way to contact him.

Andy went into his house and bounded up the stairs. He would try to call Matt in a little while to see if he was home, but first, he had to examine that cool bug.
1512121.title: Travel by Jar

15121211.content:
Andy clearly had a plan in mind. He got out a piece of paper from one of his note books and placed it on his desk. The sun was streaming in from the open window. Andy took the lid off the jar and flipped the jar upside down on the paper. Andy left Matt the bug there for a moment while he dug around in his desk drawer for something.

It took Matt a second to recover from the swift reversal of the jar. He eventually managed to get up though. There really wasn't anything that he could other than wait. It was starting to get hot in the jar from the sunlight.

Andy managed to find what he was looking for, a magnifying glass. Matt's heart jumped with excitement. Andy might actually be able to recognize Matt if he looked at him through that. Matt started jumping around with joy.

Andy lifted the jar up and noticed that the bug was getting excited. He smiled in anticipation. He carefully positioned the magnifying glass between the sun and the bug.

Matt realized that something was wrong. He had seen Andy position the magnifying glass, but it wasn't between Andy's eye and Matt. For some reason he had placed it between the window and Matt. Matt was starting to sweat from all the exertion that he had been doing. Suddenly it was very bright and very hot. With a yelp, Matt realized what Andy was doing. He quickly dived out of the pillar of light and heat. The paper where he had just been standing blackened and crumpled up. Smoke was rising from the edges.

Andy laughed as the bug tried to escape. He followed it with the light.

Matt quickly got up and ran. Andy was slowly following him with the burning light. He was going slow enough that he was leaving a trail of burned paper behind it.

A thought occurred to Matt.

Matt changed direction ran for a bit and then changed direction again. Andy laughed again as he saw that the bug had gotten disoriented and was just running around in a panic.

Matt wasn't panicking though. He had a plan.

Andy watched and followed the bug, highly amused by its antics. He had done this with other bugs before, but they hadn't been nearly as entertaining. They had pretty much just run in a straight line until Andy had gotten bored with them, and toasted them. This was though was at least making things interesting. Part of the trail behind it even looked like Andy's name.

Andy stopped concentrating on the bug and the magnifying glass and looked closer. Actually, that trail looked a lot like his name.
15121211.title: Sunny Day

choices: Kelly and her friends are down there
the antidote is where you left it, but Andy shrinks
151212111.content:
"Wait.. what the hell?"

Andy stared at the trail of scorch marks and realized that he had just spelled his own name by chasing that bug with the light. Andy closely glared at the little bug, which now that he comes to think of it, doesn't even look like a bug... it looks like a person... like Matt?!

"Whoa... Matt? Is that you?"

"Yeah its me you big fuck! Let me out of here!"

The jar amplified Matts voice enough for Andy to hear him clearly even he was quiet. Andy opened the jar and tilted it, allowing Matt to slide out onto the desk.

"Holy shit dude. I almost roasted you! This mean your shrinking juice worked?"

"It worked alright. Now I need you to take me back to my basement so i can get the antidote."

Andy nods and places you in his shirt pocket. He then takes you all the way back to your house and down to the basement, where you see that...
151212111.title: Andy read's Matt's message

choices: Andy pokes and prods some more
Andy, bored, returns bug to the jar
15121212.content:
Andy stretched out his huge body on his bed and held the jar in the air, peeking in from below at the weird bug he had captured at his friend’s home.

Definitely something odd about the bug, he decided. He would have to let Matt examine the bug thoroughly later. If anyone could determine the bug’s identity, his friend Matt could.

He chuckled as he thought of Matt. “YOU’RE PROBABLY RIGHT UP HIS ALLEY,” Andy said aloud. “HE’LL GET A KICK OUT OF YOU. HE LIKES ALL THAT WEIRD SCIENCE CRAP.”

Matt despaired. “No! It’s me, Andy! I’m Matt! Please, look closer...”

Suddenly, Andy unscrewed the lid on the jar.

For a moment, Matt’s heart leaped. Had Andy heard him?

No, that wasn’t it at all.

Andy removed the lid and tipped the jar. Matt fell, screaming, into his giant friend’s open palm.

Before he could recover from the shock, he saw one of Andy’s massive fingers headed toward him. The enormous digit smashed into him. Matt felt himself rolled about mercilessly between the skin of the giant’s palm and his huge fingertip.

Andy laughed again, amused at how he completely had the little bug at his mercy.

“TOO COOL!” Andy remarked.

He removed his fingertip and stared at the exhausted little bug as it sprawled on his palm.

“HOPE I DIDN’T HURT IT,” he remarked.

He dropped the bug on his stomach. The tiny creature remained immobile on the vast area of cotton fabric.

Matt struggled to open his eyes. He saw dimly his friend’s huge face in the distance. “No more,” Matt cried weakly.
15121212.title: No More!

choices: Andy thinks of another game for the bug.
Matt is determined to keep this up.
151212121.content:
Andy paused a moment to decide what to do next with the cool little bug.

Matt knew that if Andy could only see him as Matt, or even just as not a bug, he could stand a better chance of getting through to his gigantic friend.

Matt pulled himself upright, pausing to get used to the rhythm of the rise and fall of his friend's body as he breathed in and out. If he could only get closer to Andy, he knew his friend would spot him as a person.

Matt started the long hike on his huge friend's shirt.

Andy saw that the bug was starting to crawl up his shirt. That gave him an idea for a new game.

Matt thought he was making decent progress, a few inches at least when a shadow from above blocked out most of his light.

It was one of Andy's fingers descending again, this time to push Matt back to his starting spot, or even a little farther down Andy's stomach.

"No!" Matt yelled, and started 'north' again.

Andy laughed at the determined little bug and pushed it back again.

Matt didn't have much time to brace himself as the huge digit immediately stopped his forward momentum and dragged him backwards again.
151212121.title: Matt's Journey Doesn't Get Started

choices: Matt falls into Andy's belly button
Andy grabs the bug for something else
1512121211.content:
With a single swipe, Andy grabbed the bug back in his fist. He felt the little bug squirming, trying to get free.

With his other hand, he scrunched up the fabric of his T-shirt until it rested over his pecs.

Then, opening his fist, he dropped the tiny bug on his vast, flat stomach.

Dazed, tiny Matt needs a moment. He sees a ridge of bunched-up cotton fabric directly ahead of him. Beneath his feet, he feels Andy's warm, bare skin. Andy's body always looked smooth, but he sees a trace of fine hairs sprouting around his tiny feet. He takes a step. It is like walking through short grass.

Andy feels the bug's feet tickle his bare skin. "COOL!"

His friend's loud voice stuns Matt.

He is forced to crumple in pain again. "I've got to get him to recognize me."

Matt began to trek forward across the landscape of his friend's bare stomach.

Andy watches the bug's progress and then intervenes again.

He pushes the little bug back and then notices a fun destination.

He keeps pushing the bug across his stomach...directly toward his navel. He has a deep belly button.

Suddenly, Matt sees the indention in his friend's stomach. "No! No!" Matt screams.
1512121211.title: More Games with the Bug

15121212111.content: Andy kept pushing his friend back. Finally, Matt fell in. Andy was bored so he decided to take a nap. Hours later Matt was still in his belly button. Andy woke up and he forgot about Matt. He was going to fast food restaurant with his friend. There Matt felt hungry. So he decided to look for food. He fell out and on to Andy's belt. Andy said he had to go to the bathroom. He unbuckled his pants. The Matt fell in his pants.
15121212111.title: Matt falls into Andy's belly button

choices: Andy notices him in the washer
151212121112.content: Andy pulls up his pants with Matt inside. Matt is sqiushed between Andy's dick and his pants. Matt blacked out. Later he woke up and he was on the floor he tried to find a way out but Andy picked up his clothes and put them in the washer.
151212121112.title: Andy doesn't notice him

choices: You make it through the wash and are moved to the drier.
The wash cycle is interrupted by someone
1512121211122.content:
It was pitch dark inside the washer. You manage to climb out of the pants, but the sides are too steep for you to scale at your size. Suddenly, a torrent of water hot enough to scald you pours down on your head, almost smothering you before you manage to climb out onto the still-dry clothes. Soon, the chamber would be filled with soapy water. You attempt to stay dry, but soon the water goes over your head and you are battered about as the clothes are cleaned.

What happens?
1512121211122.title: He doesn't notice him

15121212111221.content:
The wash cycle is so cruel that Matt almost drowns, but manages to hold out long enough that the water drains out. This leaves the clothes plastered to the sides of the chamber, and Matt is trapped between two walls of wet cloth. Not that he would have been able to move much even if he was free, the pain is so great.
Finally, light floods the chamber as someone opens the door to the washer. It was Andy again, but he can't see Matt when he is trapped inside the wet shirt. Instead, two enormous hands scoop up the wet clothes and toss them thoughtlessly into the drier. Matt was once again engulfed in darkness and began to really fear for his life. He didn't think he could live through another beating.
15121212111221.title: You make it through the wash and are moved to t...

choices: He get put away with one of the pieces of clothing
151212121112211.content: The drier starts up, despite Matt's prayers that it wouldn't. The floor lurched beneath his prone body as the chamber slowly began to turn, rolling him along with the clothes faster and faster. It actually wasn't as bad as Matt had feared, since he wasn't heavy enough for gravity to pull too hard on him, but he still cracked some body parts on the metal walls of the drier hard enough to fear breaking something. The heat was also a problem. It felt like he was literally in an oven, and he was sure that he got a few extra burns to add to the ones he got in the washer. A few hours, and at least a dozen possible breaks, and one baked body later, the chamber slowed to a halt, leaving Matt to lay, only semi-conscious, frying amidst the still-hot clothing in the drier.
151212121112211.title: The drier starts up

choices: Matt is too scared to move.
Matt begins to walk up Andy's arm
15121212112.content:
Andy didn't relish the thought of having a bug in his belly button, so he grabbed it again. Matt was once again surrounded by his friend's fist, riding in darkness until his gigantic friend opened up his fist again.

Matt found himself high in the air on a narrow platform. The platform was his friend Andy's outstretched arm. Andy had often let bugs crawl up his arm. He wanted to see if this energetic bug would.

Matt froze in fear. Walking on Andy's chest was one thing, there was a soft bed to fall onto. Now he was suspended hundreds of feet over the ground.

But, if Andy would let him get close enough, he might be able to see that the thing crawling on his arm wasn't a bug afterall.
15121212112.title: Higher and Higher

151212121121.content:
"Move! Move! Move!" Matt tried to command his legs.

"No! No! No!" Matt's mind screamed back as the tiny teen had the chance to look down and see the scary drop if he should fall from the unsteady platform of Andy's massive arm.

Despite his need to contact his enormous friend, Matt remained paralyzed in fear, his feet rooted to the bare skin of Andy's wide, massive arm.

"GO ON!" Andy ordered. He inhaled and then let out a deep breath, assaulting the tiny bug with a gust of wind.

Matt felt as if trapped in the path of a hurricane. To make matters worse, Andy's breath, magnified as much as his size, smelled intensely stale.

"MOVE, YOU PUNY BUG!" Andy said, getting impatient.

Instead, Matt reached out and grabbed one of the cord-like hairs sprouting from Andy's arm. He meant to hold on in case his giant friend tried to blow him away again.

Instead...
151212121121.title: To Move or Not to Move...

choices: Andy likes what the bug did and brings it closer to look at
Andy puts the bug back on his arm, he wants it to climb.
1512121211212.content:
Andy was very confused. Bugs usually kept moving no matter what. This one was stopped and didn't seem to want to move. He could help it along.

Matt held onto his friend's arm hair for dear life. He was so focused on not falling that he failed to see his friend's outstretched index finger approaching till it was almost on top of him.

"Andy!" he screamed as the finger approached, moving just behind him to prod him along. Matt realized it might be a way out of the situation. He turned around and wrapped himself around the tip of Andy's finger so instead of pushing him along, Matt was riding along on it.
1512121211212.title: Desparate Times

choices: Matt falls off Andy's finger tip
Andy brings Matt to his ear
15121212112121.content:
"Jeez" Andy said with a sigh, annoyed by the apparent insect now clinging to his finger tip. He brought his finger to his face and squinted, inspecting the speck.-sized insect.

Matt's stomach sank as he was lifted miles, to his friends massive face. He looked up dizzily, and was shocked by the size of Andy's eye. Matt screamed, hoping to finally noticed. He was relieved when the ginatoc eye before him went wide, and he heard an ear shattering gasp.

"MATT?!?" Andy exclaimed, in total shock. Andy thrust his thumb into his tiny friend, pinning him to his finger. " How did this happen?? You're sooooo tiny!!!. "

Matt groaned, as he was pinched between Andy's house sized fingers. He was then assaulted again by his booming voice.

"Sorry !" Andy boomed loosening his pinch.
15121212112121.title: Andy likes what the bug did and brings it close...

choices: During the game, the ball heads for the jar
During the game, someone else sees the jar.
1512122.content:
Andy headed towards the door. Matt, realizing what was going on, tries to stop his friend.

"No, don't take me away! Get the antidote!" but Matt's tiny voice can't penetrate the huge jar.

Matt has a vague idea where Andy is heading. In the slight pause between Andy's steps, the jar stills for just long enough for Matt to see that Andy is heading home.

"Please let him recognize me when he get there,"thinks Matt.

Just as Andy turns the corner and heads down the block for home, Andy hears a voice calling his name. Matt is slammed against the opposite side of the jar as Andy comes to a quick halt.

"Hey man!" Matt tries to figure out who is calling Andy, cursing whoever it is for stopping Andy before he got home.

"Hey, Pete. Hey, Ted." Andy's voice booms from above. Matt recognized the names. He knew them from school, but wasn't really friends with them. Since they lived near Andy, they had become friends and hung out together whenever Andy wasn't busy with Matt - mainly for sports.

"Play some ball?" one of the other giants asked. Through the glass, Matt could see a giant orange orb.

Andy hesitated. He wanted to take the bug home and look at it so he could tell Matt what he missed, but a game of bball was fine any time.

"Sure!" said Andy, let me just find someplace to put this." Andy raised the jar to show his friends. Matt held on for dear life as the jar rocketed upwards.

"What is it?" asked Pete, who had painfully short crew cut black hair.

"A bug I found at my friend Matt's house. I wanted to look at it before I gave it to him."

"Cool." and that was the end of it. Andy lowered the jar to the ground, making sure to keep it upright so the little bug couldn't escape.

Matt, once he recovered from the downwards motion, pressed himself against the glass and was terrified to see the 3 titans looming over the jar. They were very far away at his scale, but anything could happen to the jar.
1512122.title: Interruped Journey

choices: Jump. It's quicker than climbing back down.
Climb down carefully, and then get Andy's attention.
15122.content:
Andy smiled like a hunter on a chase. He was Matt's best friend and his age; they'd been buddies since eachother were in middle school. Andy was taller than Matt and more athletic, but Matt was more academic. Despite their differences, they'd always stuck with eachother through thick and thin. But Matt had no idea how Andy would react in this situation; Andy was fun, but he was also mischevious and sometimes didn't know when to stop.

Matt dashed as far as he could, resisting the limp in his leg. He had escaped the shadow of the crane-like hand of his best friend, though, not for his speed. Andy had probably lost sight of the speck that Matt was right now.

Even once Andy's palm had stopped eclipsing the basement light (which was like a sun), Matt kept running. He churned his legs until he nearly collasped, having travelled perhaps twelve inches.

Once he was convinced he was in a safe place under the basement table, he began to breathe: first heavily, then panting. It blew his mind how much he had run and how little he had traversed. He looked up at the titan in his basemment.

Andy's palm, which Matt had had a close encounter with, seemed to have been like a footfall field. Each of his fingers were thicker and taller than trees and he couldn't help but think of the way that one could easily crush him out of existence.

Could he trust Andy to help him, or would his garagntuan friend only be amused by the situation?

Either way, Matt could have no idea from now. Andy might even never know. He would have to attempt to get to the antidote himself.

Matt took hold of a side of the desk. What looked so smooth from normal view was now full of things to clutch and various footholds. The rough wood hurt to climb up. This was an extreme sport that Matt didn't even think Andy would enjoy.

He continued to climb.

***

Meanwhile, Andy had gotten comfortable to wait for his friend. He logged into Matt's computer, only to notice that the e-mail was unopened.

***

Like cinema-sized announcements, the words of the e-mail were huge to Matt.

"MATT," read the e-mail, "DON'T FORGET THAT WE HAVE TO FINISH OUR PROJECT FOR HISTORY. I'LL BE OVER AFTER SCHOOL. TALK TO YOU LATER."

Matt's concerns were not the history project. In fact, he wouldn't have minded if Mr. Szaneck flunked him for the rest of his life -- as long as he was normal-sized.

The climb was going to be impossible. He had get Andy's atttention from the floor and hope for the best. But how would he get down?
15122.title: The Climb of the Century

choices: Matt falls on top of Andy's Adidas sneaker
151221.content:
Matt walked close to the edge of the desktop. His vertigo, absent during the monumental climb, kicked in. He felt his head spin as he gazed down toward the distant floor.

Okay. His brain told him that he was so small that the drop to the floor, most likely, wouldn't kill him.

But he could not make himself jump into the breach. He felt dizzy even drawing close to the edge of the desk.

At just that moment—

Andy, spinning around in Matt's swivel desk chair, slammed a massive foot against the desk.

For Matt, the impact felt like a major earthquake. Already precariously near the edge, he went hurtling into the abyss, screaming all the way.

Andy stopped spinning in the chair and got to his feet. It wasn't like his friend to keep him waiting. He looked at his watch and debated whether to wait a few more minutes.
151221.title: Objects in Motion

choices: Matt gets stuck in the sneaker tread
1512211.content:
The hard floor rushed to greet the falling tiny teen.

Matt saw stars. He tried to raise himself off the floor, but his spinning head caused him to drop back with a pained groan.

On his back, the shrunken teen stared up...and saw a scary sight. The sole of one of Andy's sneakers hovered just above him.

He knew he needed to get out of the danger zone, but his body wouldn't respond.

•••••

"WELL, I'VE WAITED LONG ENOUGH," Andy decided. He pushed the chair back from Matt's desk.

••••••

Matt heard the shrill sound as Andy pushed the chair away from the desk. "Oh no!" Matt cried. "He's moving."

Two huge sneakers slammed down on either side of the teen.

"Andy!" Matt screamed. "No! Don't step on me!"

A colossal rubber sole slammed down with a thunderous concussion.
1512211.title: Bad Place to Be

15122111.content:
Matt's whole vision was suddenly dark and he felt a huge thunderclap. Before he could even acknowledge it, the rest of Andy's foot came down on Matt.

He braced for the worst, but it never came up. Andy's foot entered in on an air pocket, which threw Matt upwards. He was filled with relief for a minute, before he realized he was only going up. In a dazed state of fast movement, he felt his head smash against something like rubber and his arms hit something but when he pulled away, he couldn't move. Something sticky and dirty was all over his body. There was a dull pain over his body.

And then Matt realized what had happened, as the earth came rushing up to him.

"Oh, crap."
15122111.title: Treading

151221111.content:
Matt's teeny body escaped crushing by getting stuck fast in something sticky and, more than likely, rather gross lodged in the tread of his best friend's huge sneaker.

He felt sore the entire length of his tiny body. He struggled with all his remaining strength, but whatever the sticky substance was, it refused to lessen its attachment to him.

Then, light flooded into the deep groove as Andy lifted his foot.

"Oh no!" Matt screamed.

Andy, on the move, took a step. And another, and another, in bone-jarring repetition.

Poor Matt began to wish he had been crushed. At least that would have been quick.

Each step taken by his huge friend inflicted torturous pain on the shrunken teen.
151221111.title: Lodged in the Tread

15122112.content:
Matt's whole conscious was so drenched in adrenaline that he moved faster than he could comprehend.

Unfortunately, he didn't know where to go to get out from under the all-encompasing shadow of his best friend's shoe. Matt dove left, hit the ground hard, and realized he was near the edge of the shadow. He threw himself to get across it, but Andy's shoe came down first.

Matt felt a crushing force strike his back as waves of pain went through his body. He could hear cracks, which even in his delusioned state, he estimated were his bones.

But they felt so far away, as Matt fell out of life. His last thought was what a horrible fate it was to be crushed insignificantly under your best friend's toe. For Matt, it was
15122112.title: Underfoot

choices: Matt starts climbing -- again -- but is met with an obstacle.
1512212.content:
Matt's hair parted where a stimulated wind was smashing into him strongly. Constantly, he tumbled through the air, doing unconscious flips like a gymnast. The force of the air he was falling through was mighty and Matt felt like his movement was rough and interupted over and over again.

Matt's mind worked even as the ground rushed up at him. Because he was so small, he wasn't falling right through the air, he was sort of falling *over* it. Like somebody falling down steps, Matt tumbled and fell and regained his footing as he fell through the air. It was nauseating, but slower than falling at average height; Matt knew he would survive.

He had his eyes shut to reduce the pressure of the wind against his eyes, but he opened them for a minute. He was greatly surprised: He saw a gargantuan white cruise ship in a concrete sea.

Then, Matt made the connection. He was going to land on his best friend's shoe.

He made contact with the Adidas sneaker softly, considering what the fall had been in proportion to an average fall. He lay there, silent, trying to recover from the shock of his life. He had just experienced what was equivalent to a more than 3000 foot drop. The wind was knocked out of him.

Suddenly, the ground beneath him began to shift. It was a rugged white landscape, with huge wall-thick ropes latched all over. Behind him, the tongue of the shoe loomed like a mountain. Matt couldn't believe that this new "world" he was on was just his friend's shoe. He was struck with a miserable lack of self-esteem: Here he was, the size of a gnat, clinging to his best friend (who had become a god)'s shoe (which was also bigger than the block Matt's house was on. Andy thought he was some meaningless bug and was going to kill him for fun, under his foot. Matt felt so humiliated and humbled.

The shoe shifted only a couple of inches, but it was enough to throw Matt off his legs. He thought he had hurt his leg; it hurt.

Matt looked at the tongue of the shoe, which seemed to be a mountain. But above it, Andy's jeans hung like a beanstalk to the clouds. But it wasn't the clouds: it would only lead to his thigh. Above that, was Andy's torso and head. He couldn't believe how huge Andy was. It was completely incomprehensible.

He would have to climb it, he realized. To get his friend's attention, he would have to get to Andy. He hoped his friend would just stay still.
1512212.title: Cruse Ship -- The "Titanic" Adidas

15122122.content:
Andy was getting bored, quickly. He had gym last period of the day and had rushed here right after school to meet Matt for the project. He was a bit tired.

He yawned loudly and stretched out his arms behind him, cracking his knuckles and arms. He tilted back in the swivel chair, propping up his long legs and large Adidas-covered feet on Matt's desk. He stared absent-mindedly at the moniter, then his gaze moved to his resting white Adidas. Andy's eyes lingered there for a moment - he thought he'd seen something - and then he let them drift away. Was Matt going to get here or what?

* * *

Just as Matt had taken a step to climb over the tongue of the Adidas shoe, the entire world turned upside down. And then right-side up again, and soon Matt was lost in a whirlwind of movement. To him, Andy's Adidas was the Earth and the Earth was moving. A lot.

The ground began to fly though the air, and the pressure of the air suddenly coming down on him was unbelievable. He was pushed onto his back and stuck into place as thousands of winds attacked him, knocking the air out of him and holding him against a moving landscape.

In the instant that the universe had shifted, it stopped. Lack of centripetal force meant that Matt was no longer bound; he noticed that the Cruise Ship Adidas had up righted itself. Matt would have fallen into Andy's ankle, but a tree-trunked size rope suddenly hung out of place: a shoelace. Matt, with eyes shut, grabbed the shoelace in midair and swung an inch before letting it go.

Matt soared away, about an inch above the surface of the desk; equivalently, he was very high. He hit the desk roughly, and rolled once. His nose was bleeding, but otherwise, he was suprised that he had survived. The compacting of his skeleton hadn't made him invulnerable, not anything near it, but it had made him more enduring. For the first time, he was glad he'd been shrunk.

Matt lay, battered, on the cool surface of his desk for a minute without moving. He started breathing slowly, gaining more and more breath as he found he was able to stand. His vision was blurry, but focused and he realized where he was.

In an instant, he found that he felt very insignificant. He stood in the shadow of the sky-scraper sized tennis shoe of his best friend. In sports and physical activities, Matt always felt like he was in Andy's shadow. Now, of course, he really was. Matt felt incredibly inferior: If Andy's foot was a skyscraper, Andy himself was...monumental.
15122122.title: In His Shadow

151221221.content:
"Andy! Man, please notice me!" Matt shouted.

No response. Not that he expected any. "I'm too small," Matt realized with considerable dismay.

He looked up again at the upraised gigantic sole of his friend's Adidas sneaker.

Getting out of the shadow of the huge shoe struck Matt as a good idea.

He moved closer to the keyboard attached to his coliseum-sized computer. Each individual key looked the size of a large room to the tiny teen.

Matt still could not get over how long he needed to travel even a short distance. When he finally made his way from out of the shadow cast by his enormous friend, he looked up toward Andy's face.

The giant's eyes were closed.

"He's asleep!" Matt exclaimed.

••••••

Indeed, tired and bored, Andy had fallen asleep in Matt's comfortable swivel chair.

Matt stared up in awe of his titanic friend.

Maybe, the tiny guy thought, this offered him an unexpected opportunity.

Matt didn't relish the attention of the fully awake giant, not after Andy had gone after him with those freakin' huge sneakers in the mistaken assumption that Matt was a bug.

Asleep, however, Andy didn't pose any real risk. Did he?

Matt crept closer to the edge of the desk.

The sneaker offered a bridge that could get tiny Matt onto his friend's huge, reclined body. Then, with a little effort, he could get close enough for Andy to see him or perhaps close enough to shout a plea for help in a gigantic ear.
151221221.title: Let Sleeping Giants Lie

choices: It was just an involuntary movement. Keep climbing.
Andy awakes...to find his best friend in his hands.
1512212211.content:
As daunting as the journey looked, Matt realized that he'd have to at least try. It was better than remaining his whole life the size of a sesame seed.

Matt manuevered around the computer keyboard and the tree-thick shoelaces that were lying about. Carefully, he jumped from computer key to computer key and then grabbed hold of the rough Adidas material.

He continued like this for some time, until he was at the ankle of the shoe. He could smell a stench of sweat coming from Andy's feet, but he ignored it. He had to keep going. It was now an uphill climb. He bear-hugged the denim, crawling up it like a bear. He reached the knee, finally, where Matt realized that Andy's hand was sitting. Andy was asleep, but Matt was irrationally afraid.

He reached the hand and carefully surveyed the basement. He felt like he was on the plateau of a mountain. Andy's hand was warm and soft and it was actually comfortable to sit on. He sat - indian-style - on Andy's hand to take a breath.

Suddenly, there was a shake: Andy was moving his hand. Matt tipped onto his side and began to scream.

Andy could have just made an involuntary reaction to Matt on his hand. He could still be asleep. But was he waking up? If he was waking up, he'd find his best friend in the palm of his hand. Was that a bad thing or a good thing?
1512212211.title: The Palm

choices: Matt is uncertain about his new status
15122122112.content:
High-velocity wind currents swept over the plateau-sized palm as sudden movement lifted the giant hand toward the desktop. For an instant, he feared he would be swept away by the gusts of wind, but he seemed to cling to the surface of the huge hand.

Matt tumbled on the unsteady, ascending surface. He tried to scream Andy’s name.

•••

Andy, waking from his nap, lifted his hand. He intended to rub his eyes, but caught a glimpse of something in the center of his palm. He hesitated and squinted for a better look.

Matt, terrified, saw the giant face tilt and one eye change shape as if trying to focus better on him.

“Andy! It’s me!” Matt struggled to gain his footing on the uneven landscape of his friend’s giant palm.

“MATT?” Andy’s voice sounded all-encompassing.

Matt dared to open his eyes again.

Andy looked down at his friend’s incredibly shrunken body. He extended a fingertip and tried to poke his tiny friend.

Matt screamed as the enormous wall of Andy’s fingertip crashed into him and knocked him flat on the surface of the flat palm.

Andy lost sight of his friend, and removed his finger. He saw Matt, flat on his back, staring up at him.

A winded Matt tried to scream. “Don’t do that! Please, be careful!”

Andy detected the faintest squeaks. “WHAT ARE YOU SAYING? I CAN’T HEAR YOU.”

Matt wanted to scream for Andy to find the antidote. But, when he looked up again, he saw a strange grin form on his friend’s face.

“WOW! I MUST BE LIKE A GOD TO YOU, HUH?” Andy asked.

They both knew the answer.
15122122112.title: In Andy's Hands

choices: Andy does something with his Adidas.
151221221121.content:
Andy, always the charmer, has a large grin on his face. He didn't seem malevolent, only mischevious. How could he help it? Here was this little creature, I mean, his best friend, in his hands. He wasn't sure what his agenda was, exactly, but he knew he wanted some fun first.

Most people would be shocked. Andy had already been shocked and now he was curious. That was the essence of his personality - he was always calm. Mischevious, yes, didn't know when to stop, yes, but frantic? No. That wasn't Andy.

He leaned way back in the chair, re-adjusting his feet around the computer to get more comfortable. "SO," he blasted into Matt. "HOW'D YOU GET SO SMALL ANYWAY, LITTLE BUDDY?"

The pun didn't evade Matt's mind, but he decided that it was best to ignore it. He didn't want to think - or even consider - that his friend would be difficult. Because Matt was the opposite of Andy. Matt got frantic..a lot.

It amused Andy, now, as his rice-sized friend began to leap around, waving his arms crazily like an ant in a parade. He was screaming something, but Andy could barely make it out. He knew that Matt had some speakers around here that he could hook up (actually, they were within his grasp), but Andy wanted to take advantage of the situation.

"WHHHHAT WAS THAT, MATT? I CAN'T HEEAR YOU!" Andy said these things breathily. He watched in amusement as his friend was physically pushed down by the force of his breath. "WHHHAT'S WRONG? IS MY BREATH BAD?"

It was. Matt was too small, but Andy wondered if he was tearing up from the scent. He squinted. Matt was kneeling down on his hand, pointing to his nose and shaking his head. Andy knew he was hurting his friend, but he was just joking right? It was funny.

He looked around, trying to figure out what to do next.
151221221121.title: Andy's Trip

1512212211211.content:
Andy used one hand to reach down and slip off one of his sneakers.

“HEY, LITTLE BUDDY! YOU EVER HEARD THAT OLD SAYING ABOUT BIG SHOES TO FILL?” Andy asked.

Matt, feeling very small and insignificant in Andy’s massive hand, shook his head. He could not figure out what was the matter with his friend. Why wasn’t Andy doing something to help?

Andy lowered his hand.

The closer he got to Andy’s monument-sized shoe, the more desperate Matt became. He leaped up and down, shouting angrily at his friend.

“IN YOU GO!” Andy said.

Matt screamed as he felt himself dropped. He landed with a soft squish inside Andy’s old Adidas sneaker. He felt the spongy, wet surface beneath him. A very intense, dank smell filled his nose. “Oh god! Man, Andy, your feet stink!”

He looked up. The walls of the sneaker enclosed him as if he had been placed in a deep pit. “Please, man, get me out of here,” Matt begged. He held up his arms to plea with his friend.
1512212211211.title: In His Friend's Shoe

choices: Andy has something in mind for Matt
Andy is willing to cut a deal with Matt
15122122112112.content:
"Andy!" Matt choked, trying not to breath in the rank stench around him. "Andy, please stop this! It isn't funny!" He felt as if he was in a deep cave; light was streaming in above him but there was simple darkness in what led to the toe of the shoe. The high walls and floor were spongey; they felt like felt. But they were so indundated with Andy's foot sweat, the same sweat that Matt was stepping in like a puddle. He was so nauseated.

But Andy just kept on smiling down at Matt in his shoe; he was enjoying this too much. Matt was holding his throat and gesturing to his nose, mumbling miniscule phrases.

"NOSE? YOU WANT TO SMELL MORE, LITTLE MATTIE?"

"No!" but it was too late. With flourish, like he was pulling open the curtains for a show, Andy slipped off his sock. His feet were large, a size twelve or fourteen, if Matt remembered. But now they looked enormous, a size million.

They were tan, Matt thought irrationally. Why did it matter? He was going to die, or worse, wasn't he? He would be an insignificant stain on his best friend's toe. He was frantic; the smell was getting worse.

"Andy! Please stop!"

"THERE'S ANOTHER PHRASE," Andy responded, "ABOUT GOING A MILE IN SOMEBODY'S SHOES..."
15122122112112.title: Andy's Foot

choices: Andy decides to walk to the park
151221221121121.content:
"Andy! You can't! You'll crush me!" Matt screamed as loudly as he could manage.

Even if Andy could have heard Matt's pathetic shouts, it would have been doubtful he would have been moved to respond.

He felt too much of a surge of raw power. The more he discovered how it felt, the more he craved it.

He began to slip his foot back into his shoe.

"No!" Matt screamed.

His best friend had lost his mind! But, that took a back seat to the more urgent matter of not ending up smashed into pulp by Andy's enormous foot.

Matt, exactly as Andy hoped he would, raced toward the toe end of the colossal Adidas sneaker.

Andy wore a bigger shoe than he needed. He liked having room to wiggle his toes.

For Matt, that particular trait on his friend's part proved both a reprieve and a cruel twist of fate.

Trapped in the space between the wall of the sneaker and his friend's huge toes, Matt felt the heat begin to rise. The odor from Andy's toes became quite overwhelming. Every breath of air carried more of the rank smell.

The tiny teen sweated and, in turn, soaked up Andy's profuse foot sweat.

Then, matters got a whole lot worse...
151221221121121.title: In Andy's Shoe with Andy's Foot

choices: Andy stepped on soft carpeting, it didn't hurt Matt
1512212211211211.content:
Andy went home and up to his room. He shut the door and kicked off his shoes. Matt was thrown from the shoe onto the floor. Matt was in pain from the whole adventure in Andy's shoe but now because of being tossed on the floor.

Andy walked up to Matt, his feet stopping right in front of his head," Don't think I am done with you this soon."

Andy grabbed Matt and sat down on his bed. Andy put Matt in his mouth while he took one of his socks off. then Andy took Matt and dropped him into the sweaty, stinking sock. Andy put the sock back on and started for the chores he needed to do.

" Andy no!!! You'll kill me!!!" Matt yelled.

Andy's foot went up and Matt started to slide underneath his foot bed. Matt struggled to get on top of Andy's smelling foot but he couldn't. He felt Andy's foot going down towards the floor.

" Oh no, my friend is actually going to crush me to death," Matt said.

The floor came closer and...
1512212211211211.title: In his sock

15122122112112112.content:
